Episode 7: Terra Mystica, Rambo: First Blood, and a Digital App Medley
TRCP Launch Episode 5
TRCP Sunday Fund Day Episode 3

174585.name: Flowerz
174585.description:
User Summary

This "match 3" puzzle game, based on the popular MSN game, sees you colour-matching flowers in an attempt to clear the garden board. Special icons allow you to move flowerz (the trowel) or to change the colour of one flower (the butterfly). The game gets progressively harder by introducing walls to the garden that make it more difficult to create a row of three flowerz.

174587.name: Z0MB1ES (on teh ph0ne)
videogamecompilation: I MAED A GAM3 W1TH Z0MBIES 1N IT!!!1
174587.description:
Z0MB1ES (on teh ph0ne) is a themed twin-stick shooter collection headlined by I MAED A GAM3 W1TH Z0MB1ES 1N IT!!!1, the solidly executed and utterly self-aware celebration of gaming culture through an epic musical masterpiece. Z0MB1ES does its best to span both musical and gaming genres in a streamlined series of choreographed music video gameplay mashups. Paired with an exclusive music-driven psychedelic shooter, Time Viking, as well as the ENDL3SS Z0MB1ES game mode, Z0MB1ES is infectious fun.

Source: The Developer Website.

174588.name: DoDonPachi Maximum
174588.description:
Hardcore shooter action at your fingertips!

BEGINNERS CAN JUMP RIGHT IN! EASY MODE INCLUDED! - If you're not sure you've got what it takes, start off with Easy Mode. Once you’ve conquered that, test your mettle with Normal Mode!

OPTIMIZED FOR ONE-FINGER WARFARE! - Weave through walls of bullets! Smash through the enemy and build combos! Manic, full-throttle gameplay, all controlled with your thumb!

Remixed BGM included! - Remixed versions of classic Dodonpachi series tracks included! Remix composer WASi303 has written a new soundtrack for a new Dodonpachi world!

Source: The Game Website.

174589.name: After Burner III
174589.description:
After Burner III is a video game released for the FM-Towns home computer in Japan and later ported to the Sega Mega-CD in Japan, Europe and North America. It is the third game in the After Burner series, and a port of Strike Fighter, a game released for Japanese arcades, itself a sequel to G-LOC: Air Battle.

The game again has the player flying the F-14 Tomcat, with the same weapons as before. Headquarters has informed you that "the enemy" (which the game's introduction does not identify) is reported to be building airfields and bases throughout the desert. Your mission is to take out those bases, and if you get rid of a few enemy planes in the process, "so much the better".

After Burner III differs from After Burner II significantly. Several new cinematic sequences are featured in the game. The "rolling mode" in the game is now optional. Also, two selectable in-game views are available from the main menu. The first view is the game's default, which is "cockpit". This gives you a view similar to that of common flight simulators. The second type of view available is "back", which is similar to the After Burner II arcade game. However, the "back" option has the rear of the plane obstructing the view of the targets that your vulcan cannons and missiles are supposed to shoot at.

Another difference in After Burner III is the music. There are a number of new tunes, along with altered versions of After Burner II'.

Source: Wikipedia, "After Burner III", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

174590.name: The Flayed King
174590.description:
Designer's Summary:

The Flayed King started out as Tullius Well. I had the map, and in my game the Northmen use wells in their religious ceremonies. So I started writing this with that in mind and somewhere from my mind the concept of the Flayed King came into mind. Heavily borrowed from the story of Odin gaining his wisdom and losing his eye. This guy didn't fair so well. Also throw in a bit of Arthurian mythos and a dash of Egyptian and this is what I came up with.

Within the adventure you'll find a new cultural item and a new, minor artifact. I think both are cool and hope you find them interesting.

User Summary:

A Micro Adventure, published by Tim Shorts on his Patreon page.

174591.name: Casino
174591.description:
From publisher blurb:

In the shadier part of town, there's a casino. The owners are mysterious, and the staff are not to be messed with.

Whether you want a location for an evening's play, or a home base for your Adventurers, there's something in here for you.

This adventure location is suitable for any modern setting, and includes stats for OneDice, D100 and retro-D20. It is intended to be used with Dramascape's full colour combat map. Both can be bought together - look for the discounted bundle!

174592.description:
This game is a simulation of an exercise held at a military training ground involving tanks and helicopters. There are three levels. In the first level only tanks participate. In the second level are added combat helicopters. In the third level participate transport helicopters and Surface to Surface Missiles.

The main characteristic is that the game board is covered with a net of equilateral triangles. Vertices of these triangles are points at which the players hold position and move figurines.

Players have a task to destroy enemy headquarters or to use transport helicopters which carry commandos who can capture enemy headquarters and in that way make a quick victory. Other way of determining the winner is by counting points. Every hit, destroyed tank and shot down helicopter counts as one point.
174592.name: Helicopter and tank battle

174593.name: Miles Away: Wynn Bay
174593.description:
From publisher blurb:

FT – Miles Away – Wynn Bay is a community setting off a northern sea that is a mining and lumber center. While the town sits off a small bay in an island setting it represents a struggling but growing pocket of “humanity” as it were. This town setting is part of the Numb Island area adventure which has a dragon problem which is only touched upon in this setting.

This adventure setting was designed for 1st/2nd Edition AD&D for the Filbar Campaign for any level adventurer and DM. This adventure setting is easily adaptable to most any game and system. Save yourself some time and utilize it for a one shot adventure or a continuing campaign!

174594.name: Klammeraap
174594.description:
This is a game similar to Skat but with an Rhenish touch and some special rules that differ from the original Skat.
The gameplay is quite simple: each player plays a card and the player who played the highest card wins all played cards. The player who has collected the most tricks when all cards are played is the winner of the game.

Text on the box:

Das Rheinische Doppelklammerskatspiel

"Klammeraap" ist das ultimativ spaßige rheinische Familienkartenspiel mit Elementen aus Herzblättchen, Doppelkopf und Ramsch. Leicht verständlich, unterhaltsam und überraschend.
Die Schachtel enthält 45 Spielkarten und eine ausführliche Spielanleitung mit vielen witzigen Sonderregeln, die für Spaß und Abwechslung sorgen. Wem die kölnisch-ripuarische Mundart noch fremd ist, mit der die Karten bezeichnet sind, der kann sich trotzdem entspannt zurück lehnen. Ein Wörterverzeichnis liegt bei.

174595.description:
The game represent a simulation of aircraft maneuvers, which are held in Western Europe every year. All squadrons participating in maneuvers have image of a tiger in their emblem. The first such exercise was held back in 1949.

This is a game for 2 or 4 players. Each player has one base with airport. In the base are anti-aircraft guns, ammunition depot, radar, ... The game has 3 levels. In the first level are light attack aircrafts and fighter-bombers. In the second level supersonic attacker aircrafts are added, and in the third level interceptors are added. The planes are armed with guns, bombs, Air to Ground missiles and Air to Air Missiles.

The main characteristic is that the game board is covered with a net of equilateral triangles. Vertices of these triangles are points at which the players hold position and move figurines.

Each player has a task to achieve as many hits as possible in the enemy bases. Every hit and shot down aircraft counts as one point. The game lasts as long as players have planes and bombs, missiles... The winner is the player who has the best ratio of given and received hits.
174595.name: Tiger meet

174596.name: Vaterpolo
174596.description:
The game represent a realistic simulation of water polo. The game lasts 4 x 10 minutes, but it can also be played for a certain number of goals.

In each turn the player who attacks rolls three dice and moves three pieces and the ball. The player who is defending rolls two dice. The attack is limited to five turns.

Content:
Box 24 x 24 x 4 cm (9,5 x 9,5 x 1,5 in); Board 47 x 47 cm (18,5 x 18,5 in); 2 cardboard goals; 15 pieces; 2 markers, 5 dice; score counter and rules.

174597.name: Der Rote Baron
174597.description:
Back of Game Box:

Experience the thrill of flying biplane and triplane of WWI. Defend yourself in spectacular dogfights while enemies attack you from all directions. Run bombing missions and dogfights and deceive their opponents with clever tactical maneuvers.

174598.name: The AnalogXP (Issue 3 - Jul 2014)
rpgissuearticle: New Tastes in Brazilian LARP: From Dark Coke to Caipirinha to Nordic Ice
174598.description:
From publisher blurb:

July was a really rushed month for me getting everything prep for GenCon and publishing two issues of The Analog XP. August really paid off and the trip to the US was amazing. But one thing didn't get out of my mind the whole time...

Well, the thing is that at my last day in Brazil some guys from the Larp scene here finally gave me their impressions on the final version. It's not that I got something wrong (actually they really liked it) but some things should be added. We have this great medieval larp called Kaldjorn that I totally forgot and there also were some little clarifications on the text. Nothing much, but I decided to reupload it since I actually didn't had the time to properly announce this edition prior to my trip. I just uploaded it to Patreon and that was it. Even our Facebook page and Wordpress still show the #2 as our latest one. Time to fix it.

I also took this opportunity to try a new feature: Interactive Table of Contents! Just click it on the introductory page and it should take you right to the article you want to read. This will be a regular feature on every new issue from now on.

In this issue:

The Brazilian LARP - Through foreign live action experience, how did the Brazilian Larp create its own identity
Full Game: Listen at Max Volume - Members of a band gather again fifteen years after its end. A Larp about nostalgia, sorrow and new starts

174599.name: Tormentum - Dark Sorrow
174599.description:
A nameless hero finds himself in a place between fantasy and nightmare. He doesn't remember his name nor where he comes from. Wandering through strange lands, he struggles to discover the truth about the world around him, as well as about himself.

The dreamlike, nightmarish atmosphere of the game was inspired by the works of painters H.R. Giger and Zdzisław Beksiński. The game's final look and feel was also strongly influenced by the universes of games such as Demon's Souls or Dark Seed. This unique mixture gave life to a bleak and depressing world.

The story begins as the protagonist wakes up locked in a metal cage hanging below a large flying machine. It becomes clear he is its passenger against his will and the machine's destination is unknown. The only vague memory he can summon in his mind is that of a sculpture atop a hill, depicting human hands reaching towards the sky.

Those are, however, the least of his problems as the airship descends its flight towards a huge, gloomy castle which soon becomes his prison. Thus begins the surreal story bordering somewhere between dream and reality...

Source: The Publisher Website.

174600.name: The AnalogXP (Issue 4 - Sep 2014)
rpgissuearticle: But Before Talking About Gen Con...
The Map: RPG Cons in Brazil
Weaving Theories: Why I Abandoned RPG
174600.description:
From publisher blurb:

So now things change a little and I guess the content will be something really enjoyable. After spending the first 3 issues introducing our community, I'll start introducing some of my personal theories and also some thinkings from some other game designers around here. At this issue me and Eduardo Caetano will talk a little about how all this time reading and playing foreign games really changed the way we think about games, heavily inspiring us in our first attempts, both really successful. But we will also talk about Julio Matos thinking on why we shouldn't call all the games we play RPG. That is something we discuss a lot around here and seems to be not that frequent in the US discussions. Let's find out.

You will read on The Analog XP #4:

GenCon 2014: We were at the best four days in gaming and here is our experience
Narrative DNA: Years playing foreign games defined a generation of Brazilian RPGs, but did something change now?
Why I Abandoned RPG: Julio Matos says why the term RPG is not so good to define most of our narrative indie games
FULL GAME: Metroyska Journal - A breathtaking three player game about treason, war, and survival inside a sunk soviet submarine at the bottom of the ocean

174601.name: The AnalogXP (Issue 5 - Oct 2014)
rpgissuearticle: Design Matters: A Trend in Brazilian Game Design
GameWhat?: Transcription of the GameWhat Documentary
174601.description:
From publisher blurb:

So issue number 5 is finally online! This was a very cool month here in Brazil with a lot of different discussions. We had presidential elections and most people were really into discuss almost about anything! On top of that many talks about how our market is going. Our economy still favor the internal market what makes international shipping almost impossible for us, and that shouldn't change anytime soon since our last president got re-elected. So the best I can do for now is keep working on digital content!

In this Analog XP you will find:

GAMES AS ART? The old discussion about games as a new art form gains a new perspective through story games
STORY VS CHALLENGE Should this be something to discuss at all?
DESIGN MATTERS A look on how Brazilian games really care for their looks and how could that affect gameplay
Full Game: LOOKING FOR HOME A profound solo game focused at the search for things to really care for

174602.name: Theatre of War 3: Korea
174602.description:
Back of Game Box:

A new episode of the popular series "Theatre of War" allows you to relive the events of the first war in the era of the Cold War, the Korean War.
Dissatisfied with the status quo on the Korean Peninsula, the North Korean government decided to stop the dialogue. North Korean ground forces crossed the 38th parallel and entered South Korea at 4:30 of June 25th, 1950, with an armed intervention aimed at reunification. Nobody would have imagined that this would lead to one of the bitterest wars ever seen, with thousands of casualties on both sides in a period of three years.

174603.name: The AnalogXP (Issue 6 - Nov 2014)
174603.description:
From publisher blurb:

We have a bunch of new popular foreign games being launched here and this translation thing is something that have been bothering me for quite some time, since I decided to first launch my game PULSE in English. But how does someone translate some work to another culture?

This is also an edition where I changed how Full Games will be handled. Well, like evertything else here, this is a new experimentation on my behalf. I always hated how the format of the magazine changed for some games we published and it used to just greatly enlarge the size of the magazine. Another thing is that these games are mostly prototypes frequently being tested and updated, but Patreon still does not let us re-upload files. So I decided to keep the games in an environment that I can edit and change the files so you'll always have access to the latest version available.

But I had this idea just 5 seconds ago, so give me a little time to crop all the games into independent files. Now it's 3 AM here in Brazil and I'll have to wake up early in the morning to ship the new version of my game PULSE, entitled PULSE Fast Play, to early birds that already bought the game. So I probably will work on the games just later in the day. But be patient, everything will work out for the best ;)

In this issue:

Interviews: LOST IN TRANSLATION? What are the main worries when decoding a game to a different language? These are the guys we asked that:
AISLAN DE BORBA ( Our Last Best Hope )
MATHEUS FUNFAS ( FATE Core )
ANESIO VARGAS ( Numenera )
GILVAN GOUVEA ( Iron Kingdoms )

SPEED DESIGN The experience on writing one game a month for almost an year
full game: PRISONER - A GMless story game about survival and co-op between enemies isolated in a hostile planet

174604.name: The AnalogXP (Issue 7 - Jan 2015)
rpgissuearticle: FVM: Do It Yourself - Game Creation Contest - February
174604.description:
From publisher blurb:

Our first XP of 2015 comes with lessons far away in time and space! Not that far, actually. But how can we relate our game design community to an event in the Cold War: The ASTP joint mission? With Americans and Soviet could work together during a really tense war, I'm sure us peaceful game designers can too! But there's more to it.

This is what we have in this issue:

LESSONS FROM SPACE - What can game designers learn from one of the most unprobable space co-op missions in history, the Apollo-Soyuz rendezvous?
GAME COMPETITION - All about 2015 brazilian design contests and why the "competition" actually are bringing developers closer to each other
VERSUS 2014 - Last year we talked a lot about the Versus project, creating one game per month during one year. Finally a list with all our creations and some more opinions on it

174605.name: The Royal Marines Commando
174605.description:
Back of Game Box:

1941. We are in the midst of World War II. Great Britain, that fight alone against Nazi Germany, is on the verge of collapse: the German submarine blockade continues to deprive England of a vital part of its supplies. The Germans are working on a new submarine project, the Type XVIII, propelled by revolutionary HTP engine designed by Professor Helmut Walter.
To get more information on this secret project, Churchill sent in action in a German naval base in northern France, the Royal Marine Commandos. Their target is to penetrate the whole Kriegsmarine command and seize all the secret information.

174606.name: The Talented Rogue's Guide to Rogue Talents, Vol. 1
174606.description:
From publisher blurb:

Do you want to play a rogue who can hit the ground running, cut a foe's feet out from under them, and dispatch a trained ferret to rob folks blind? Now you can! With The Talented Rogue's Guide to Rogue Talents, Vol 1 you'll find all new ways to make the rogue of your dreams! Within this book you'll find:

16 original rogue talents, from con artist to whip training!
5 original advanced talents, from blinding attack to sly sundering!
2 new unbalanced talents for those who like to play dangerously!
7 original full-color illustrations depicting these talents in action!




Take this book and run with it. That's what a true rogue would do!

174607.name: Battlestrike: Shadow of Stalingrad
174607.description:
Back of Game Box:

The motherland needs you, comrade!
August 1942: the Nazis have occupied much of Europe and now have their eyes on the mighty Soviet Union. Their victory key is the fall of Stalingrad. Take part in the battle in the rubble of the city and invert the tide of war before it is too late. Use tactics of sabotage, murder an important German scientist, steal secret documents from a heavily guarded enemy base. Use original weapons of the time, both Russian (PPSh, Mosin Nagant, Tokarev SVT40, Diektariev) and German (MP40, Luger, Kar98, MG42, MO44).

174608.name: Magical Instruments
174608.description:
From publisher blurb:

Behold the Magic of Music!

The fantasy genre is full of musical instruments that possess great magical powers, and, when played, can have all kinds of incredible and wondrous effects. While there are certainly a few magical instruments to be found in the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game Core Rulebook (a surprising number of them horns), there’s always room for more.

As a result, we’ve packed this book with seven never-before-seen musical instruments that are also wondrous items. Percussion specialists can enjoy the somber tones of the drums of the dead, which are great for séances, but can also empower poltergeists and bring peace to restless spirits. The persistent notes of the fey fiddle can be heard even in areas of magical silence, and anyone who plays it well finds that it makes fey creatures very friendly indeed. Or, for those who enjoy brooding over their instrument in true theatrical fashion, consider the grand piano of the infernal maestro, whose keys can not only produce music, but, in the right hands, open up portals to hell itself. All these and many more instruments can be found in this tome!

174609.name: Rush for Berlin GOLD
174609.description:
From the back cover:

Fight the final battles of World War II in this strategy game with tanks. Join the race to reach the capital of the Reich alongside the Allies and the Red Army. Get ready for the great counter-offensive by the German army!

174610.description:
Alien Frontiers Big Box includes:

Alien Frontiers
Alien Frontiers: Factions
Alien Frontiers: Faction Pack #1, #2, #3 and #4
Alien Frontiers: Expansion Pack #1, #2, #3, #4, #5, #6 and #7
Alien Frontiers: Outer Belt
174610.name: Alien Frontiers Big Box
boardgamepodcastepisode: TRCP Launch Episode 1
TRCP Sunday Fund Day Episode 1

174611.description:
ION: A Compound Building Game is a card drafting game where players select from a number of available Ion Cards and Noble Gas cards with the goal of creating sets of compounds and inert noble gases.

Here’s how the game is played: Each player is dealt eight cards, must select one of those cards and then passes the remaining. Players must choose to either bond (pair) their selected card with another Element Card or set it alone (possibly to form an ionic bond at a later time). Throughout the game, players gain additional points for building specific compounds which are listed on the Compound Goal Cards and have available a set of Action Tiles which award them additional moves throughout the game. Players score points based upon the quantity and type of neutrally balanced compounds they construct and noble gas sets they collect. After three rounds, players add their total scores from each round, subtract points from Action Tiles used, and the player with the most points wins!
174611.name: Ion: A Compound Building Game
boardgamepodcastepisode: Boardcast News 4.16.15 | Podcast of Nonsensical Gamers
Da qualche parte bisogna iniziare – Il Dado Incantato #1
TRCP Launch Episode 8
TRCP Sunday Fund Day Episode 4

174612.name: Boardroom and Curia
174612.description:
Publisher Blurb:
Strength In Numbers

From street gangs to armies, through political and religious groups, to businesses all the way up to multinational corporations, organizations feature prominently in many adventures. They can be tough to get a handle on, though. Juggling lots of people and resources can leave you feeling like "GM" stands for "General Manager," not "Game Master"!

GURPS Boardroom and Curia comes to the rescue with a simple-but-effective framework for defining organizations for use in adventures. Its stats block offers a way to write up a group in much the same way you would a city (compare GURPS City Stats), an army (see GURPS Mass Combat), or a spaceship (as in GURPS Spaceships). At a glance, you'll know just how powerful they are and how quickly they can respond, and have a concrete idea of what that means in terms of skill levels, point values, or dollars.

Boardroom and Curia also includes a full chapter on how to use these stats when the PCs work for or against an organization – or decide to found one! Rounding it out are seven detailed examples suited to a variety of tech levels and genres: three real-world groups (the Medici bank, the Provisional IRA, and Médecins Sans Frontières), two that support existing GURPS settings (Biotech Euphrates for Transhuman Space and the Raiders of the Black Void for GURPS Cabal), the sinister Cold War conspiracy of Dr. Zynfami, and a superhero alliance (the Mid-City Defenders).

Stop being confused. Start getting organized!

174613.name: MYFAROG (1st Ed.)
174613.description:
from the back of the book

Do you like fairy tales, fantasy, horror and mythology? Then MYFAROG is the game for you!

To play MYFAROG you only need this book, pencil and eraser, paper and somewhere to play. You also need at least three normal 6-sided dice. Finally you need a creative and inventive myth master (a game master) and at least one player. You have everything you need in this book to make your own adventures and campaigns, meaning you can play the game for as long as you like without further purchases.

MYFAROG is a game where a myth master leads one or more players through a story. Each player takes the role of a made up individual, a player character, and to a large extent decides how the story shall go. The game is similar to child's play, where you dream and pretend and play in an imaginary reality, but MYFAROG gives this play structure and frames, via the myth master and rules.

174614.description:
Players craft potions in a secret marketplace. Hide ingredients to deceive opponents, and use magical powers to mix concoctions. But beware - your opponents are brewing schemes of their own!

Apotheca is played on a 4x4 grid. Players gain points by making matches of three potions of the same color in a row. The first player to make three matches wins. It's easily learned, but the combination of asymmetric powers and secret facedown potions make the game a delicious challenge.

On each turn, players take 2 of 4 possible actions:

Reveal: Reveal a secret potion and gain a gem of that color
Restock: Draw, look at, and place secret potions on the board until there are exactly 3
Power: Use one of your active apothecary powers
Hire: Spend gems to hire new apothecaries




Whenever a player makes a match, they must place it on one of their apothecaries. This removes that apothecary's power for the rest of the game, so it's important for players to keep revealing potions, collecting gems and hiring new apothecaries... all while keeping their opponents at bay!

Deduction is key to Apotheca. Players trap each other with clever spatial moves, bluffing and misdirection. The action economy is very well balanced, so every turn offers an opportunity for strategy and tough decisions.

The feeling of the game differs with every number of players:

2 player is the most cerebral and controlled
3 player is the most chaotic, yet still within your grasp
4 player is played in teams, offering neat collaborative gameplay
174614.name: Apotheca
boardgamepodcastepisode: Apotheca Review with the Game Boy Geek
Dukes of Dice - Ep. 45 - The Quilting Guild
Origins Spectacular 2015
Vox Republica 116: North Wind (Is Totally Not A Pirate Game)

174615.name: Chroniques Oubliées - Le jeu d'initiation
174615.description:
User Summary

This RPG is only available in French

Chroniques Oubliées is a version of the OGL d20 System in a Fantasy setting, published by Black Book Editions
This starter set is suited for beginners and/or children, from the age of 10, up to level 4 characters.

It contains the rule booklet, the GM screen, four adventures, a map, and a set of dice.

Chroniques Oubliées remains compatible with d20 compatible games, including D&D 3.5 and Pathfinder.

174616.name: President Nation
174616.description:
User Summary

President Nation invites players to achieve their own political and governmental ambitions:

1) At the local city level, where they can become a Police or Fire Commissioner, Councilman, and even the Mayor.
2) At the state level, where they can become State Legislators, Lt. Governor, and the Governor.
3) At the national level, by becoming US Legislators, Vice-President, and ultimately, President.

Political Networking:
Political Allies in President Nation are a powerful way to advance your career in the game. Each friend plays an important role in your career by 1) Networking with those who have power to appoint you to a higher position, 2) Helping your friends advance their own career, and 3) Finding allies that will endorse and campaign for you.

Political Power and Influence:
In President Nation, players can achieve significant power and influence by becoming an elected official. Mayors, Governors, and the President may introduce legislation to increase or decrease taxes on their citizens while elected legislators may vote on legislation important to their citizens. By achieving positions of power, players can help their citizens achieve their ambitions and create a world of prosperity or economic turmoil.

Voting: 
President Nation includes a brand new game mechanic where players wield their own influence by voting for their choice of the candidates. Players can pick and choose a candidate that they feel benefits their city, state and nation. With such an important ability, players can help create the world of their dreams.

Government Career Tracks:
Players can start their own governmental career in a city of their choice. Players, for example, can start off in the Police Department of a city by becoming a Police Cadet. When a higher position becomes available players can move up ladder and make a higher salary. Each city has departments for players to choose from so they can advance their career. When a player is ready, she can run for an elected position and let others know by using campaign tools available in the game.

174617.name: WW2: Lost Chronicles
174617.description:
WW2: Lost Chronicles is a PNP wargame for 1-2 players. The game is a fan made project for fun & sharing.

It is a tactical wargame based on historical battles & fictional what if battles. Game scale is 250 meters per hex & roughly 5 minutes per turn. Game unit is platoon size(company for USSR). A game will last 6 - 12 turns or with a variable turn system.

Each player is a regimental commander who controls 4 - 9 companies. All companies are color coded & under command of a battalion HQ. A HQ can issue orders to three companies (three colors). Platoons of same color are from same company which should share same morale & training. Morale of a company will vary from scenario to scenario.

Air-support, OB artillery, reinforcement, mines, snipers, hidden units, weather change & other unexpected battlefield events will be handled by cards. Leadership will be implemented by command points & cards.

There is also a solitare mode in which a player will play as a fictional regimental commander who will do daily routines like refit, replace units or send units for patrol & recon when there is no action. Enemy force is unknown until first contact. Your regiment will gain more & better resources if you proof yourself in battle. If you see too many casualties, you may request to retreat from battlefield & end the battle of the day but withdrawal request is not always permitted depending on the overall battle situation.

There is a battle-fatigue system. As a regiment commander, you choose which of your one/two battalions or attached companies will be upfront for attack or defense mission. The company will get one fatigue point for mission without contact and two fatigue points for contact with enemy force after each mission. A company's morale will drop by one if fatigue point is 2 or more. So you need to decide whether to send more troops upfront or call troops back for refit to remove fatigue points.

174618.description:
In Schäferstündchen — which is playable by four, six or eight players — you are either a bandit or a citizen in the battle for sheep. Race into the valley and fight with the other players over a herd of sheep. Play cards to stop the others from advancing or weaken them while you make yourself as strong as a shepherd can be.

Each player plays a card for himself and for another player face-down. Then the cards are turned face-up and the effects are resolved. The cards can either make a player stronger/faster or they can have several weakening effects. After that you move your figure towards the valley where the players fight over the sheep by comparing their modified fighting skills. The strongest ones take a sheep home, just to start another race towards the valley next turn until no sheep are left. The one who collected the most sheep wins.
174618.name: Schäferstündchen
boardgamepodcastepisode: Schäferstündchen: Spiele-Podcast Nr. 248

174619.name: Verkehrsspiel
174619.description: The players start on space 1, have to visit all numbered spaces in the right order and return to space 1. While doing this, they have to mind the traffic signs. Movement is determined by a die. The first player to return to space 1 wins the game.

174620.name: Blades in the Dark
rpghonor: 2015 Golden Geek RPG of the Year Nominee
2015 Golden Geek RPG of the Year Winner
174620.description:
Publisher Blurb

"The streets of Duskwall are haunted. By vengeful ghosts and cruel demons. By the masked spirit wardens and their lightning-hooks. By sharp-eyed inspectors and their gossiping crows. By the alluring hawkers of vice and pleasure. By thieves and killers and scoundrels like you — the Blades in the Dark.

The noble elite grow ever richer from the profits of their leviathan-hunting fleets and electroplasm refineries. The Bluecoats of the constabulary crack skulls and line their pockets with graft. The powerful crime syndicates leech coin from every business, brothel, drug den, and gambling house. And then there's your crew of scoundrels: all the way down at the bottom rung. Can you make it to the top? What are you willing to do to get there? There's only one way to find out..."

Blades in the Dark is a tabletop role-playing game about a gang of criminals seeking their fortunes on the haunted streets of Duskwall. There are heists, chases, occult mysteries, dangerous bargains, bloody skirmishes, and, above all, riches to be had if you're bold enough.

You play to find out if your fledgling crew can thrive amidst the threats of rival gangs, powerful noble families, malicious ghosts, the Bluecoats of the city watch, and the siren song of your scoundrel’s own vices.

174621.name: Rush for the Bomb
174621.description:
From the back cover:

Test the experience of atomic arms race in live. Helps the allies to protect highly confidential informations or help the Axis forces to steal data. And it is up to you to decide whether the documents arrive in Berlin through Lisbon and Spain neutral.

174622.name: The Excellent Travelling Volume (Issue 2 - Feb 2015)
174622.description:
The Excellent Travelling Volume
Issue #2
February 2015

Cover art by Jason Sholtis.

174623.name: 30 Alchemist Discoveries
174623.description:
From publisher blurb:

Sometimes, all you need to have fun with a class for another few months is a few new ideas to tinker around with. Class Expansions is a series of lightweight supplements for The Pathfinder Roleplaying Game that takes a base class and offers alternative class features that, handily enough, each fit on one page or less.

Following in this vein, Class Expansions: Alchemist Discoveries introduces 30 new alchemist discoveries, including a series of new mutually-exclusive mutagen discoveries that follow the same design rules as some rogue sneak attack talents or alchemist bomb discoveries.

174624.name: Further Afield
rpg: Beyond the Wall and Other Adventures
174624.description:
From publisher blurb:

An exciting supplement for convenient campaigns of Beyond the Wall and Other Adventures.

Sometimes heroes must wander…

Shadows gather throughout the world, threatening you, your village, your friends, and your family.

The lands are wide and wild, filled with dangerous foes and fantastic treasures. You are a little older now, ready to see the world far from the village, face the darkest threats, and make your own legend. It is time for you and your companions to leave home.

Travel further afield...

Just as Beyond the Wall and Other Adventures provides for an exciting evening of play with zero prep, Further Afield offers guidelines and rules to create and run an extended campaign in the same spirit. Now the players and gamemaster work together to create the myths, legends, and rumors of a unique setting. Included in this book are all the necessary tools to create your world, travel and explore within it, defeat great and terrible adversaries, and reap the rewards of adventures even further beyond the wall.

Collaborative player-driven campaign creation for making your own shared sandbox.
Threat Packs for dynamic villains and dangers affecting the world beyond the village.
Helpful hints and systems for integrating new characters into existing groups.
Rules for creating magical items through your crafts, deeds, or sorcerous powers.
Four Threat Packs, including the Blighted Land and the Vengeful Wyrm.

174625.name: The Outpost of the Outer Ones
174625.description:
From publisher blurb:

From the depths of space come the Outer Ones, better known as the Mi-Go. They travel the universe looking for metal to mine and brains to steal. Now they have landed on a planet ruled by sorcery and steel...

YS1 - The Outpost of the Outer Ones is a fantasy adventure module for early editions of the world's most popular fantasy role-playing game, particularly the first Advanced Edition, but directly usable with virtually every OSR game. Despite being inspired by the works of H.P. Lovecraft, it is a dungeon module, not horror or investigation. It is meant for character levels six through ten, depending on which rules system used.

174626.name: Dark Tales: Edgar Allan Poe's The Gold Bug
174626.description:
Edgar Allan Poe’s classic tale gets a reboot in this fourth game in the well-loved Dark Tales series. You and your detective companion Dupin have been summoned to the seashore to help William LeGrand discover the exact location of a treasure lost hundreds of years ago. But LeGrand isn’t the only one with designs on the pirate booty… A masked villain tries to make off with the code, and a mysterious woman in a veil seems to be connected. Follow the clues – with the help of the superior sniffing abilities of your Newfoundland sidekick – to track down the treasure and foil the criminal’s plans.

Source: The Developer Website.

174627.name: A Twisted Tea Party
174627.description: This twisted tea time party game was inspired by Lewis Carol's "Alice's Adventure in Wonderland." Who will out wit whom in this zany tea party? This mixed up game has two to five players trading seats and switching cards in an attempt to be the player who can score the most points in a round before one player completes a full tea setting.

174629.name: Skattjakten
174629.description:
A strategic kids game with the goal to get the treasure at the bottom of the sea.

The game is set up by setting three boards on top of each other and each players sets his/her pawns in position. By strategically decide which die (as these have different numbers) to roll the player will try to move into the holes in the current layer. When all holes are filled, the current layer is removed along with all pawns that are not in a hole. The last layer contains only one hole, which leads to the treasure.

174630.name: Cards: The Attackening!
boardgamepodcastepisode: Vox Republica 076: The Giant PAX East 2015 Recap
174630.description:
Cards: The Attackening! is a limited collectible card game (LCCG) for 2 - 5 players. Games take anywhere from 15 - 45 minutes, depending on how many people are playing. The game works on a system of sharing decks. I.e., instead of everyone bringing separate decks, there are three decks in each copy of the game from which every player draws. Specifically, Cards: The Attackening! consists of an Attackener deck (characters); Arsenal deck (Pets, Weapons, Armor, Evasions, and miscellaneous Items); and Twists of Fate (scenarios that affect gameplay - e.g., SciFi Attackeners gain a certain advantage while attacking.).

The game is played by every player drawing three Attackeners, three Arsenal cards, playing their first Attackener and then rolling to see who draws and plays the first Twist of Fate. The player with the highest roll chooses three Twists of Fate, and choosing the one that benefits them the most. That player then draws one Arsenal card, plays one, and attacks an opponent by rolling a die. Damage is determined by the amount rolled (1 is a miss, 2 is half damage, 3-5 is full, and 6 is double). If the opponent does not evade the attack, they take the damage and the move is passed to the next player, who follows the above steps to complete their turn.

When an Attackener's health is depleted, the person who beat that Attackener collects the card as a trophy. The person who was beaten chooses the next Twist of Fate, but does not play their next Attackener until it is their turn to play. This gives them a few rounds of immunity while play continues. The game is over when one player has collected three trophies from any player in the game.

174631.name: Eleciones en Lanolinas
174631.description:
24th July 1993, La Ciudad, Republic of Lanolinas.

People are celebrating, flocks of sheeps coming form the Meseta are invading the streets, the Plaza Merinos, hearth of the Nation, where the Parliament overlooks the Presidential Palace, is overcrowded... the dictatorship has finished!

The President Candidates of the two main Parties, National and Popolar, are speaking to the crowd... the elections are set in the next month!

Will you manage to win the Elections, gain the majority at the Parliament and elect the President?

Welcome to Eleciones en Lanolinas!

A 18 card game fast and interesting!


Here some hints on Lanolinas:

Capital City: La Ciudad

Goverment: Presidential Republic

History: Found by Colombo in 1495, Lanolinas gets its name from the flocks imported from Spain since 1545. La Ciudad is founded in 1553 as commercial distribuition of the wool here produced. Since 1648 Lanolinas is a Spanish Royal Colony, till the indipendence, declared on 19th March 1891.

As independent republic, Lanolinas is influenced by the US and knows a period of dictatorship, ended in 1969 by the Marxist Revolution of Ignacio Las Casas. At its death, in 1980, Guillermo Rosas restores the Presidentail Republic using terror and corruption, till its recent resignements.

Economy: Sheep Wool, treated into the Woolen Mill, the main local industry.

Politics:there are two main parties, National and Popolar. The country is divided into three Constituencies, each electing one Candidate to the Parliament:

First: La Ciudad, urban, with officies, University and Army Headquarter;

Second: El Centro, rural, with medium villages with shops and the Woolen Mill.

Third: La Meseta, rural, with small villages, farms, sheep breeding, hills.
The game is for two players,each represents one of the political parties of the Republic of Lanolinas; one is the National Party (its badge is a blue N), the other is the Popolar Party (its badge is a red P).

Each Party shuffles its Candidates cards (with its party badge), draws all four of them, turns them on the opposite face and gets the Candidate President and a Candidate for each Constituency.

Each Party has to nominate the Candidate President and to assign one Candidate for each Constituency, showing them on the table in echelon.

The country is divided into three Constituencies, each electing one Candidate to the Parliament:

First: La Ciudad, urban, with officies, University and Army Headquarter;
Second: El Centro, rural, with medium villages with shops and the Woolen Mill.
Third: La Meseta, rural, with small villages, farms, sheep breeding, hills.

Game Rules (available on cards as well)
Each Candidate has a Vote Value valid in all or some Consituencies only, a Note with a special empowerement of a specific Electoral Card and might have a Candidate President Special Ability too, to be used if designed as Candidate President.

Then after having shuffled the Electoral Cards, each Party draws 4 cards each; these are the cards to be assigned to the Constituencies in order to get the most Votes and therefore manage to elect its Candidate in the Constituency.

The Ecards are valid in specific Constituencies only, it is possible that a Party doesn't have any Ecard in a Constituency.

Each Party assigns the ECards for each Constituency face down; when all the cards have been assigned, the Polls start and the ECards are revealed, starting from the First Constituency.

If any Candidate President Special Ability is to be solved, solve it when necessary; the exchange of one Ecard is with an adverse revealed one at Candidate choose!

In each Constituency each Party calculates how many votes got (including the Candidate President Vote Value where is valid and all the appliable Notes of the Candidates), the most elect its Candidate at the Parliament; in case of draw, the seat remains unassigned!

The party with the most elected Candidates elects its Candidate President as President of the Presidential Republic of Lanolinas.
In case of draw, the Elections are annulled and the game restarts.

The President’s Party can retain one card for the new Eleciones; one Candidate (kept to be used as Candidate President or Constituency Candidate) or one ECard, which will be not reshuffled but kept apart.

Then restart the game for a new Electoral Campaign!

A Party wins if gets the President elected three times on five Elections.

Will YOU manage to make your Candidate President?

174632.name: Solar System Spin
174632.description:
Solar System Spin is a spin-and-move game where players move along a track from Pluto to the sun, trying to collect planet cards with facts about the planets. Along the way, the spinner may send players to the black hole, supernova or worm hole, causing them to move backward, lose turns or lose cards.

The first player to reach the sun with at least three planet cards wins.

174633.name: The Lion King
174633.description:
Scar plots to get rid of Simba by telling him about a dangerous elephant graveyard. Just as he hopes, Simba and Nala head for this forbidding place, where a pack of hungry hyenas await them. Can you help King Mufasa rescue the cubs?

Published in Disney's Giant Board Game Book, The Lion King is a roll-and-move game where players must move two markers representing Simba and Nala simultaneously along a track, trying to reach the end and be rescued by Mufasa. Along the way, they may land on spaces that move them forward or backward or cause loss or gain of turns. If a player lands on another marker, they move back six spaces, and in order to start moving a marker at the beginning of the game, they must roll at least a three. The book comes with an "electronic" die that generates random number from 1 to 6. A small element of strategy is added by the ability to move either marker, offering the choice to move the marker that will land on an advantageous space or avoid a negative space.

174634.description:
A mob of angry villagers, led by Gaston, has decided to invade the forbidding castle in order to kill the Beast. Belle saddles Phillipe and sets out to save the Beast. However, you must help her to get to him before the last petal of the Enchanted Rose falls, or the Beast will never become a prince again.

Published as part of Disney's Giant Board Game Book, Beauty and the Beast is a roll-and-move game where players take the part of Belle, rushing to save the Beast. Each player in turn presses the "electronic die" and moves the indicated number of spaces along the track. Each player also has a marker on the rose board, indicating petals falling from the enchanted rose. As they move along the track, they will land on spaces that may move them forward or backward or cause loss or gain of turns. Landing on another player's marker moves a player back 2 spaces. Players landing on spaces marked with a rose must move their marker one space forward on the rose board. The first player to reach space 42 by exact roll without their rose board marker reaching the end of the rose board rescues the beast and wins.
174634.name: Beauty and the Beast

174635.name: Outlast: Whistleblower
174635.description:
The plot follows Waylon Park, the anonymous tipster to Miles Upshur and shows the events both before and after the main plotline.

Source: Wikipedia, "Outlast", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

174636.description:
This premium 30-piece set of acrylic ghost rock tokens contains 15 small (1/2 inch) white skulls for 1GR, 10 small translucent dark grey for 2GR, and 5 large (1 inch) fluorescent green skulls for 5GR.

This product is not affiliated with Alderac Entertainment Group, AEG, or Pinnacle Entertainment Group. The pieces are made in the USA by Litko Game Accessories.
174636.name: Doomtown: Reloaded – Ghost Rock Tokens

174637.name: Wasteman
174637.description:
Prepare yourself for the bizarre as you venture deep into a world of radioactive insanity!

Wasteman: A game of desperate conflicts in a desolate future! A frantic game, set amongst the ruins of a neglected and scorched earth. Engage in desperate battles between post-humans, hideous monstrosities and killer robots over the dregs of an age of gluttony. Take control of you own syndicate and test your metal against the weird and terrifying denizens of the wastes!

Wasteman is a fun, easy to learn, and refreshingly crazy game! Players or 'comrades' control syndicates, typically comprised of between 5 and 20 ruthless denizens of the wastes, in an attempt to vanquish their opponent, survive bizarre encounters and/or capture much needed supplies.

During a game of Wasteman, comrades take it turn to activate individual figures to perform several actions; such as attacking, moving, hiding or even bringing people back to life with the power of their mind in some cases! Figures can normally only be activated once per turn so you have real scope for strategy – goad your opponent into activating the wrong figure at the wrong time and they could be left open to all sorts of cunning shenanigans!

Once a syndicate drops below 5 figures they become desperate and the restriction for activating a figure only once in a turn is lifted. This leads to some really cinematic moments, where often lone survivors hopelessly attempt to fend off hordes of enemies and occasionally succeed! This really keeps the game fun right until the last man.

Figures take different kinds of damage – they can be spooked, crippled, seriously injured, or killed outright. To make it easier to remember what’s happened, each figure comes with a base equipped with slots and removable tokens. These are cast in high quality resin and are included with all but the largest figures. Each figure will receive 1 base out of 10 designs selected at random.

M.A.D cards really bring the crazy to the game! Each comrade receives a hand of 5 M.A.D cards that can be played at any time (for the most part) to either help yourself or hinder your opponent. There’s nothing quite like having the enemy boss abducted by aliens just before riding a conveniently timed tornado to the objective on the last turn! Though normally limited to 5 cards, you can seek the aid of traders or vending machines to top up your hand during a game leading to some very tense moment as your prize fighter sits in the middle of the battlefield kicking a coffee machine.

The cards themselves are lavishly illustrated by yours truly, and beautifully printed on quality playing card stock.

As well as a myriad of rules for hazards, mods to alter the game and a stockpile of scenarios, Wasteman has an in depth syndicate creation system, with loads of equipment, skills and Boss Rosters to choose from. Although each figure comes with a stat card, you are more than welcome to create your own and/or combine figures from different posse packs – the choices are vast!

Wasteman miniatures are sculpted by hand to approximately 35mm scale and will be cast in metal, unless specified to the contrary. All figures will come with stat cards and token slot bases. They will be supplied unpainted and, in some cases, unassembled.

174638.name: The Murder of Mr. Crow
174638.description:
User Summary:

A game in which a group of friends will create a murder scenario together by taking turns playing the detective and the suspects they create.

174639.name: BioMet Infection
174639.description:
from the designer

This is the electronic release of the BioMet Infection RPG.

In a few pages, the game contains the background setting, in classic cyberpunk style, the adventure seed, the characters' sheets to play with, and the instruction for the Master. This is all you need for a few sessions of play.

The BioMet Infection is a cyberpunk RPG for 4 players and a Master, inspired by John Harper's Lady Blackbird, based on mechanics vaguely resembling Vincent Baker's Apocalypse World.

Background:

A known scientist is found dead; his body is revealed to be the one of a mutant, and the agent in charge of the case is mysteriously killed. An unknown virus called BioMet is spreading into cybernetic implants like a cancer. The sprawl is in turmoil, divided between criminals, cyberpunks and mutant rebels. Multiple reports indicate the appearance of the so-called MetZ, once humans, now infected cyborgs. Four special agents are called to investigate.

174640.name: Arrowflight Second Edition
174640.description:
Back Cover:

Arrowflight contains everything you need to create a fantastic character to guide through adventure, exploration, and political intrigue, in a land of magical beasts and supernatural terror.





A time of strife. A world of wonder. How will you answer Destiny's call?

174641.name: Mini Pirates
174641.description:
From the publisher website:
Mini Pirates è il gioco di ruolo,della Mini G4m3s Studio, che vi porterà a impersonare dei temibili Pirati Steampunk.

English translation:
Mini Pirates is a Mini G4m3s Studio role play in which you will impersonate fearsome Steampunk Pirates.

174642.name: Mini Rock
174642.description:
From the publisher website:
Pensate a un mondo dove suonare e ascoltare della buona musica rock diventasse illegale. Oppure se ci fosse della gente che è pronta a manifestare e anche in modo pesante per impedirvi di divertirvi ascoltandola non vi ribellereste?

English translation:
Think of a world where playing and listening to good rock music wuold be illegal. Or if there were people who are ready to manifest and also to violently stop you enjoy listening to it, will you become a rebel?

174643.name: Mexico Ablaze: A Solitaire Game of the Mexican-American War (1846-1848).
174643.description:
BACKGROUND: Mexico Ablaze is semi-historical simulation of the Mexican-American War (1846-1848). The Game begins shortly after the United States of America (USA) and Mexico have begun hostilities near the border of the Rio Grande. The Mexican Army is now building up their forces to kick the United States out of Mexico. The US must capture enough Mexican controlled Settlements before the Mexican Army is able to effectively mobilize an overwhelming force.

OBJECTIVE: Player takes command of the United States Forces in Mexico. The Player’s Objective is to attempt to capture three or more of the five Key Mexican Controlled Settlements of Monterrey, Buena Vista, Vera Cruz, Tampico and Mexico City before the “Treaty of Guadalupe Hidalgo” Campaign Card is Drawn. If the Mexicans capture 3 of the four US Settlements of Fort Texas, Laredo, Corpus Christi or San Patricio, they win. Also, if the US has not captured three of the four Key Mexican Settlements and the “Treaty of Guadalupe Hidalgo” Campaign Card was played, the Mexicans Win.

GAME FEATURES: Mexico Ablaze features many colorful game counters of the various Unit types that fought in the Mexican War, including individual Heroic Officers that later served in the Civil War. Battles can be fought on a large Battle Mat and includes assaults on fortified settlements.

MEXICO ABLAZE can be found at http://www.berserkergames.net

174644.name: L'Era di Zargo
174644.description:
From the back of the book:
Sono passati 500 anni dalla Guerra dei Signori. Ai grandi conflitti che hanno devastato Zargo è seguito un periodo di pace duratura, l’Epoca dei Patti. Ma nella fredda Landa Brumosa, teatro di un ultimo tremendo conflitto tra l’armata dei Sette Devoti e l’ultimo Signore dei Venti, i demoni sopravvissuti alla sconfitta del Caos stanno uscendo dai loro nascondigli...

English translation:
500 years have passed since the War of the Lords. The great conflicts that ravaged Zargo have been followed by a period of lasting peace, the Epoch of Covenants. But in the cold Misty Land, theater of a last terrible conflict between the army of the Seven Devotees and the last Lord of the Winds, the demons that survived the defeat of Chaos are coming out of their hiding places...

174645.name: Ascendant: Heavy Metal Fantasy
174645.description:
From the RPG website:
It’s that nagging irritation you’ve had with every other Pen and Paper RPG you’ve ever played. It’s the answer to 20 years of playing games but being frustrated with all of their unspoken limitations. An answer which has taken the last eight years to come to fruition. Why can’t your character become totally epic, yet still maintain a level of interesting play?

boardgameintegration: Orcs Must Die! The Board Game: Order Edition
Orcs Must Die! The Board Game: Order Edition
174646.description:
The award winning game Orcs Must Die has made its way to the table top! Orcs Must Die: The Boardgame dares you to preserve your stronghold sieged by orcs. You have traps & weapons galore, and can team up with your friends to obliterate the nasty orcs and their grotesque allies.

Orcs Must Die: The Boardgame includes scores of figures of favorite heroes, plus hordes of orcs, crossbow orcs, kobolds, gnolls, trolls, ogres, and more. Build an exciting fortress using a tile-based system, then watch as swarms of baddies plunge through your defenses to abolish your Rift.

Orcs Must Die: The Boardgame actually consists of TWO separate games! One is based on the heroic Order, while the other is for the Unchained. Both are complete stand-alone games. In Order, you’ll play heroes such as Maximilian the War Mage, Gabriella the Redeemed Sorceress, and others, while fending off the villainous orc onslaught. In Unchained, you play opposing heroes, such as the Kobold King or Midnight the assassin, facing down assaults by human soldiers, lions, elves, bears, dwarfs, and the like.

How Is It Played?
First, you and your friends choose your heroes – each individual game supports 1-4 players, who must co-operate to survive the enemy onslaught. Each hero has his own individual sheet, with his unique characteristics, special ability, and his secret superpower, that he needs to save for just the right moment. He also comes with his own special figure and his own weapon cards that no one else has access to.

When you think you are ready to go, choose a difficulty level, and a map – you can select one of the maps we’ve included, or create one of your own! A typical map is made up of from 4 to as many as 13 tiles (or even more, if you are inventing your own design). The game has a lot of pieces to play with, but the map itself is reasonably tight, and will fit just fine on a typical gaming (or dining room) table.

Finally, the fight begins! Each turn, waves of orcs and other monsters move pitilessly through the map, relentlessly aiming for your poor Guardian, trying to destroy him and your Rift. You and your allies run around the map, placing traps in the various parts of your map, battling the invaders, and performing a host of other actions.

You earn trophy skulls for killing your enemies, and these act as the game’s “cash” – spend them to buy new weapons, magic amulets, and a host of other items. You also can spend skulls to place traps, and to upgrade your Guardian, making him better-able to hold off the orcs, gnolls, and other enemies.

But over time your enemies accrue in strength, too! You have to face three Onslaughts, and with each Onslaught, your foes increase in might. If you do not lay a solid groundwork for your defenses with upgrades and trap placements in the early part of the game, you may face doom later on!

Combat is straightforward and fast – you roll various colored dice depending on what type of weapons and upgrades you own. Remove “killed” enemies from the map, only to see them replaced by new waves each turn. The fun continues. The game builds up over time to a crescendo of doom, in which the last few turns see you frantically try to finish off the final waves of the onslaught before your crippled Guardian is destroyed!

Head-to-head play?
If you or your friends own both the Order and Unchained versions of Orcs Must Die: The Boardgame , you can go head-to-head, pitting the regimented Order against the legions of the Unchained in an epic conflict. You and your friends will split into two teams – one side fights for the Order, and the other will control the Unchained.

Each side has its own heroes, its own armies, its own Items, and its own traps. Your hero can defend your own citadel, or seek to lead your armies to victory inside the enemy lair. With friends to help, your faction can station heroes at both tasks, and even switch off duties. The game supports up to 4 players per side.
174646.name: Orcs Must Die! The Board Game: Unchained Edition
boardgamepodcastepisode: TRCP Launch Episode 5
TRCP Sunday Fund Day Episode 3

174647.name: Euro Truck Simulator 2 - Scandinavia
174647.description:
Euro Truck Simulator 2, just got better with the addition of this Scandinavia add-on. Featuring Sweden, Norway and Denmark, you’ll have access to mile upon mile of the Nordic motorways across these three beautiful countries.

Features
• Transport a vast array of cargo across the whole Scandinavian peninsula
• Run your own haulage business which will continue to expand even whilst you take on an array of contract haulage driving jobs yourself
• Build your own fleet of trucks, buy garages, hire drivers and manage your business for maximum profits
• Tune your vehicles to keep them in tip top condition
• Customise your transport fleet with optional lights, bars, horns and beacons
• Thousands of miles of real road networks with hundreds of famous landmarks and structures

Source: The Publisher Website.

174648.description:
Sylvion: Below Ground is a 16-card expansion that adds an additional challenge to Sylvion.

Shuffle the cards, then place them face down in the 4x4 battlefield grid. During the game, when you want to place a tree or a fountain on a terrain card on the battlefield, you must first pay the cost, then reveal the terrain card. Then:


If the terrain card is unoccupied, remove it from play and place the tree or fountain in this space.
If the terrain card shows an owl, remove it from play, place the tree or fountain in this space, then draw two cards from the defender deck.
If the terrain card shows a swallower, remove it from play along with the tree or fountain that you were going to place; you receive no compensation. (If the removed card was a fountain, draw one card from the defender deck as if the fountain were defeated in battle.)
174648.name: Sylvion: Below Ground
boardgamepodcastepisode: Low Player Count - Ep. 15 - The Filler Episode

174649.name: Robodice
174649.description:
Robot for the world invasion was out of control during the experiment! In order to activate the emergency stop program, it's insert a stop key to all the robot quickly!

In order to play this game the player have to provide 5 D6 that are not included in the game.

The goal of the game is to be able to put out all the dice on the slots on the game board in order 1 to 5.

You put out all the dice in order 1 to 5 on the different slots on the board, the problem is that each slot have an effect on the dice that have not yet been placed. The slots can make you either turn up or down the results of one other die, you could re-roll 1 or all dice and one slot will let you turn over one die to the other side (For an example 1 to a 6 or 5 to a 2).

This is a postcard sized solo game that was given away free at Essen 2014

174650.name: TIME VIKING!!!!!ANDSPACERAPTOR
174650.description:
This controversial long lost research project conducted by Ska Studios and Neurologische Entwicklung GmbH is available now on XBLIG! The subject of heavy criticism from ethicists and pragmatists alike, Viking’s “Adaptive Neurothreading” technology allows for unprecedented aura connectivity, but at what cost?

Source: The Developer Website.

174651.name: Zombie Army Trilogy
174651.description:
In the dying flames of World War II, Hitler has unleashed one final, unholy gamble – a legion of undead super soldiers that threatens to overwhelm the whole of Europe. Fight alone or team up to save humanity from the zombie menace in this apocalyptic third-person shooter!

Battle through THREE epic campaigns across 15 demon-infested missions. Play solo or fight back to back in online co-op for 2-4 players. Dare you take on one of the most intense and challenging third-person shooters in gaming?

Face gruesome enemies with iconic weaponry and powerful explosives. Dismember the undead to give yourself a fighting chance, and experience every putrid lung burst, every rotten bone shatter with the infamous X-ray Kill Camera.

The ultimate horror package – alone or with teammates

Experience THREE nerve-shredding campaigns across FIFTEEN missions of intense third-person action.
Take the fight to the undead alone, or team up in 2-4 player online co-op.
Face your fears in the brutal new Horde Mode for 1-4 players, across 5 blood-curdling maps.
Gut-wrenching gunplay

Defeat harrowing legions of zombies, armoured skeletons, fire demons, chainsaw-wielding elites - and worse - before facing the demonic Führer himself!
Shred the undead with genre-best rifle ballistics, powerful firearms and deadly explosive traps.
Wince as your bullets shred the insides of the undead in gruesome detail with the return of the series’ acclaimed X-ray Kill Camera.
Customise your carnage

Choose to play as one of FOUR male or FOUR new female survivors.
Perfect your play style with CUSTOMISABLE weapons and loadouts.
Customise your DIFFICULTY and add enemy multipliers. Surely you would never brave “X4” on Sniper Elite difficulty ... or would you?
Recut. Remastered. Unleashed.

Includes the first two Nazi Zombie Army games like you’ve never seen them before.
Pick apart zombies with the new DISMEMBERMENT mechanic and bathe in a bloody glow of NEW graphical effects, NEW audio, NEW enemy animations ... and more.
Play your favourite missions from ANY campaign in ANY order in ONE unified online community.
Source: The Publisher Website.

174652.name: Fire on the Velvet Horizon
174652.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A book of monsters. A monster book. They are a land under a hazy sun.

174653.name: Guardian War
174653.description:
Guardian War is a console RPG or tactical role-playing game released for the 3DO console. It is notable for its use of 3-D animation which was uncommon for console RPGs at the time. It is also known as Powers Kingdom (パワーズキングダム Pawazu Kingudamu?) in Japan and Europe, and is one of the few 3DO games which is region protected.

Source: Wikipedia, "Guardian War", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

174654.name: Return Fire - Maps O' Death
174654.description:
From Back of Box

Maps O' Death is the follow-up companion disc to the award winning Return Fire, allowing players access to over 100 new map configurations. Each map allows players to devise new and exciting strategies and ultimately capture their enemy's flag. More maps, more levels, more destruction.

174655.description: This expansion includes 4 additional Vortex tiles. They have similar function as the teleport, although their range of effect is greater: 12 surrounding tiles instead of 3.
174655.name: Galaxy of Trian: Wormholes

174656.description: Dungeons & Dragons: Attack Wing – Earth Cult Warrior Expansion Pack includes one pre-painted miniature, upgrade cards and tokens.
174656.name: Dungeons & Dragons: Attack Wing – Earth Cult Warrior Expansion Pack
boardgamefamily: Dungeons & Dragons: Attack Wing Miniatures Game

174657.description: Dungeons & Dragons: Attack Wing – Air Cult Warrior Expansion Pack includes one pre-painted miniature, upgrade cards and tokens.
174657.name: Dungeons & Dragons: Attack Wing – Air Cult Warrior Expansion Pack
boardgamefamily: Dungeons & Dragons: Attack Wing Miniatures Game

174658.description: Dungeons & Dragons: Attack Wing – Fire Cult Warrior Expansion Pack includes one pre-painted miniature, upgrade cards and tokens.
174658.name: Dungeons & Dragons: Attack Wing – Fire Cult Warrior Expansion Pack
boardgamefamily: Dungeons & Dragons: Attack Wing Miniatures Game

174659.name: 101 Dalmatians
174659.description:
Cruella hired Horace and Jasper to kidnap lots of Dalmatian puppies. She wants to make a fur coat out of them. Can you help Perdita and Pongo find all of them and bring them back home?

Published as part of Disney's Giant Board Game Book, 101 Dalmatians is a roll-and-move game where players take the part of the Dalmatian parents Pongo and Perdita, trying to save their puppies from the evil Cruella de Vil. Each player in turn presses the "electronic die" which generates a random number from 1 to 6 to move two markers representing the dogs simultaneously along a track, trying to reach the end and be save their offspring. Along the way, they may land on black paw prints or white paw prints, which move them back or forward six spaces respectively. Other spaces may also move them forward or backward or cause loss or gain of turns. If a player lands on another marker, they move back five spaces. A small element of strategy is added by the ability to move either marker, offering the choice to move the marker that will land on an advantageous space or avoid a negative space.

boardgamehonor: 2015 Golden Geek Best Family Board Game Nominee
2015 Vuoden Peli Strategy Game of the Year Winner
174660.description:
Relive the dawn of modern New York City, the historic years that made it what it is today. Build bigger and higher skyscrapers on some of Lower Manhattan's most iconic streets. Raise one of four legendary skyscrapers — the Park Row, the Singer, the Metropolitan Life, or the majestic Woolworth — and make one of them the crown jewel of your real estate empire!

In New York 1901, the players are building skyscrapers on a map of New York's Financial District. Players take location cards from a card's display and then use 2-3 of those location cards to place Tetris-shaped building tiles on the board. They first build bronze level buildings. Later in the game those buildings can be replaced by silver level and gold level buildings.
174660.name: New York 1901
