174661.name: Twenty Yard Shamble
174661.description:
In the future, sooner than you’d bet on…

As the world progressed towards the future, the wealthy elite one-percenters found themselves losing their passions. Golf’s formerly exclusive clubs were opened to the masses, horse racing was banned as cruel, and auto racing was found to be not "carbon credit cost effective". The elite needed a new pastime.

Fortunately for them, a new class of mass-spectacle gladiators was found. Questionable lab projects involving human-cloning, attempting to solve the world’s worst diseases, created a global zombie pandemic. Luckily, the crisis was put down quickly – but the lab-created undead still existed.

Someone with a bit of redneck, and way too much time, picked up a few up zombie “assets” at a company bankruptcy liquidation. After a little tinkering, he managed to build a control collar contraption. When a zombie was outfitted with a collar, a skillful operator could, sort-of, get the zombies to walk in a straight line. Conveniently, the undead had no legal rights, which made them the perfect attraction.

A viral video and a crowd-sourced funding campaign later, these not-so-intelligent shamblers were being billed as the latest thing in racing spectacles. Wealthy backers quickly formed teams, a league and championship cup was created, and the wealthy few who could afford the labs, zombie jockeys, and all that related to it now had a new prestigious exclusive club.

As with all good clubs, betting became part of the social fun. As one could never really count on one’s zombie to come through, betting for, or even against one’s own entry into the race was not only allowed, it was encouraged!

While these new zombie drivers competed against each other for the series championship, the owners had their own prestige cup based on bets, side bets, crowd ratings and worse.

Bet on your friends zombie driver to make the podium … SURE! Bet on your zombie to place third … WHY NOT? WIN when your zombie shambles over the line backwards … CHECK!

Welcome to the wacky, zany, risky but always crazy world of high stakes championship zombie racing!

In Twenty Yard Shamble, players are owners of racing zombies. They pit their zombie against the other zombies, in a series of 3 races, out of an arena where armed Hunters and helpless Victims prowl. Zombies move in a semi-controlled fashion based on dice rolls. The arena has 6 finish lines spaced equally around the outside edge. The first zombie to cross a finish line is first, and earns points for it's owner AND anyone who bet on it. The second zombie to cross gets second, and the third zombie gets third. After the third zombie crossed a line, the crowd gets bored, and all remaining zombies are shot and killed.

During a race, players place bets on any of the racing zombies, including their own. If a players zombie is not performing well, that player can place a bet on another player's zombie who is performing better, and may be able to help that zombie finish better in the race.

At the end of 3 races, the player with the most points wins.

174662.description:
The year is 596 A.D. and the Gregorian Mission has decreed a conversion of all pagans to Christianity. Under attack, the Druids - the prophets and scholars of ancient Paganism - must try and prevent the Christians from spreading their new religion, but it won’t be easy. As the church gathers more converts, they grow stronger with each passing day...

Druids is a press-your-luck style dice game with a twist where, with the help of the gods, you play as a priest of the ancient Celts, desperately trying to stop the Christians from converting your believers. The twist is that the other players are rolling against you! If they can convert your believers, the victory will be theirs instead. Use the special abilities of the gods to keep the missionaries at bay and keep your faithful strong.
174662.name: Druids
boardgamepodcastepisode: The First Roll - What's New on Kickstarter? - Episode 69: Tuesday, September 27th

174663.name: The Little Mermaid
174663.description:
King Triton has lost his magic trident. He sets out to search for it with Sebastian, Ariel and Flounder. They find a sunken ship at the bottom of the sea, and divide into two teams. Which team will find the trident and end up with the most objects?

Published in Disney's Giant Board Game Book, The Little Mermaid is a roll-and-move game where players must move along a track, collecting objects along the way as they try to reach the end of the track and find King Triton's trident. Players choose to play as either Ariel and Flounder or Triton and Sebastian, and press the "electronic die" to move along separate tracks which merge at the end. As they progress, they may land on spaces that move them forward or backward or cause loss or gain of turns. Some spaces are also marked with objects to collect (designated by taking a marker). The player who finishes with the most objects collected wins.

174664.name: Tryptic
174664.description: Tryptic is a tile placement game involving bluffing. Players try to create multiple copies of their own (secret) pattern, without anyone else noticing, and try to determine which patterns other players are creating.

rpg: Talk Find Make: Punch-Proof Problems for Peace-Loving Adventurers
174665.name: Talk Find Make: Punch-Proof Problems for Peace-Loving Adventurers
174665.description:
Inspired by media like Doctor Who, Nancy Drew and MacGuyver, this little game is part of Daniel Solis' Smart Play Lab Series.

From the Introduction:

This is a simple system for "pacifist adventure" role-playing and storytelling games. Here the heroes find non-violent solutions for a big dilemma. The heroes might follow a code of peace, the antagonists could be physically invulnerable, or the heroes are just outnumbered. No amount of punching will help. It's up to you and the other heroes to Talk, Find, and Make a solution.

174666.name: Aladdin
174666.description:
Aladdin has lost the magic lamp! You must help him and Princess Jasmine find it before Jafar does.

Published in Disney's Giant Board Game Book, Aladdin is a roll-and-move game where players must press the "electronic die" to move two markers representing Aladdin and Jasmine simultaneously along a track, trying to reach the end and recover the magic lamp. Along the way, they may land on spaces that move them forward or backward or cause loss or gain of turns. A small element of strategy is added by the ability to move either marker, offering the choice to move the marker that will land on an advantageous space or avoid a negative space. The first player to reach the end of the track with both markers wins, and the other players must "grant three wishes" to the player by roaring like a genie, making a face like Abu and flying around the room like a magic carpet.

174667.description:
Faith and the Sword! Paladins serve as a shining beacon of purity and hope in a world beset by darkness. The Paladin Class Deck, a portable play accessory for the Pathfinder Adventure Card Game, allows players to bring these guardians of duty and honor to any Base Set, including the demon-filled Wrath of the Righteous campaign.

The 109-card Paladin Class Deck contains 3 new characters, including the iconic holy warrior Seelah, and enough new and familiar weapons, spells, mounts, and other boons to bring your paladin through an entire Adventure Path. The deck is self-contained, so you can play your character at any table, and is also all you need to dive into the exciting Pathfinder Society Adventure Card Guild organized play campaign.
174667.name: Pathfinder Adventure Card Game: Class Deck – Paladin

174668.name: Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs
174668.description:
Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs are out in the woods picking berries. The forest animals warn them that the wicked Queen, disguised as an ugly old hag, is after them. In order to deceive the wicked Queen, Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs separate into four teams and set out, each in a different direction, for their little cottage.

Published in Disney's Giant Board Game Book, Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs is a roll-and-move game where players simultaneously move four markers on a grid, trying to get all four safely to their designated cottage. Each player presses the "electronic die" and then chooses one of four markers to move from its starting point onto the grid. Markers must make their entire move either vertically or horizontally, not both. Many grid squares are marked with various character, events or objects from the movie. Landing on these may move the player's marker or cause loss or gain of a turn. An element of strategy is added by the ability to move any marker, offering the choice to move the marker that will land on an advantageous space or avoid a negative space. The first player to move all four markers from their starting spaces to the safety of the cottage wins.

174669.description:
Operation East Front is a solitaire game of Combat on the Russian Front during World War II. The player assumes the role of a German commander of an Infantry Company during a German Offensive Operation to advance on a Key Soviet City. As the Company Commander, you are responsible for securing your Sector of Advance by successfully taking and holding key objectives with the least amount of casualties. Although there are many support units available to you, they may often times be limited to you by political, logistical or geographical obstacles.

GAME OBJECTIVE
The objective of Operation East Front is to successfully take and secure an number of key objectives and destroy enemy forces in order to gain Victory Points (VP) for the German Forces. Once all Objectives have been secured or the Campaign Deck is exhausted, the Campaign is considered over. The Player must then total his VP and compare this with the Victory Determination Table to determine the level of success.

You can find Opeation East Front at http://www.berserkergames.net
174669.name: Operation East Front: A Solitaire Game of Tactical Combat on the Russian Front

174670.name: Wizard's Mansion
174670.description:
Wizard's Mansion is a game of search of objects, missions and deduction. It is played on a mobile board of 36 tiles that moves and turn. The tiles are drawn in his two faces. Every face represents a floor of the Mansion.
The players will have to enter the Mansion to look for magic objects and to go out with then for one of four doors. But in the Mansion it has soldiers that will prevent your mission and the Wizard who will be able to turn you into a ghost.

Descripción en Español:
Wizard's Mansion es un juego de búsqueda de objetos, misiones y deducción. Se juega sobre un tablero móvil de 36 baldosas que se mueve y giran. Las baldosas están dibujadas en sus dos caras. Cada cara representa un piso de la mansión.
Los jugadores deberán entrar en la mansión para buscar objetos mágicos y salir con ellos por una de las cuatro puertas. Pero en la mansión hay soldados que impedirán tu misión y el Hechicero que te podrá convertir en un espectro.

174671.name: Quest for Karma
174671.description:
User Summary

Quest for Karma is a short puzzle game with the player investigating an ancient culture through a series of puzzles unearthed through an archeological dig. Each puzzle reveals some cultural nuance, and is set with calm, inquisitive music and settings.

There is one mini-game asteroids "shooter" style game where chess pieces are to be prevented from crossing the board to your side. Otherwise, the other puzzles are not time or reflex based and allow the player to think them through at thier own pace.

174672.name: Spell Components (Core)
174672.description:
From publisher blurb:

Purple Duck Storerooms are short pdfs of experimental material. Spell components have lost of their luster over the years. They are a forgotten piece of non-equipment due to one culprit--the spell component pouch.

Within these pages you will find a complete list of material spell components and spell focuses organized by spell level. This list is designed for players to used to add more description back into their game without having to reference the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game Core Rulebook at the table, or for gamemasters who are mindful of the fact that spell components pouches do not contain things with specific costs nor things that wouldn’t fit into the pouch. It is also a handy list for obsessive compulsives who have not made their own list yet.

174673.name: Wicked Temptations
174673.description:
From publisher blurb:

From the dawn of time, humanity has been plagued by temptation. The oldest stories we still tell are of the tempter and the temptress.
Preying upon our weakness and our emotional natures, demons and devils continue to torment us, even more so because in our modern hubris we believe our rationality to have overcome such childish superstitions.
Demon-hunter, do you have the will and the skill to defend us from the terrors beyond the veil?
It is up to you to fight the Darkness.

Wicked Temptations contains rules for demonic possession, exorcism, demonic artifacts, and, of course, demons and devils of all types. Wicked Temptations is a must-have for all aspiring demon-hunters and exorcists.
Wicked Temptations is an expansion of the rules in Modernity (Fate Edition) and the core Modernity text is required to fully utilize Wicked Temptations. It is fully compatible with other Fate Core products. All minor variations are documented in the core Modernity book.

174674.name: Faiths of the Archipelago
174674.description:
From publisher blurb:

This document gives an overview of Kettepihu an ancient city on the northern coast of Angulor. It talks about the origins of the Dysang, a cult that is the origin for the racial name of the Angdesi. Inside is a short adventure set in Kettepihu, information about the faithful of Anga, Iteyu of Fire, and other points of interest regarding the faithful and the power they wield.

174675.name: The Wererat's Well
174675.description:
From publisher blurb:

Rats in the Well!

Plague and terror in Willowford! When a small village is riddled with disease, only a company of brave adventurers can save the town from this mysterious infestation. Plunging down the well they discover wererats, wights and other terrors in The Wererat's Well - the first in Barrel Rider Games' White Box Adventures line of products. Designed for a party of 6 to 8 characters between 1st and 3rd level, you'll find a full adventure, an overview of the village of Willowford and two new monsters - all for Swords & Wizardry WhiteBox!

174676.name: Rangers of the Burning Plains
174676.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Burning Plains is a vast and wild land, with miles and miles of lawless frontier between the scattered towns. That is the domain of the Rangers.

Born from conflict, the Rangers are the most elite Lawmen on the plains. Charged with riding into the unforgiving wilderness in pursuit of the deadliest of outlaws, the Rangers are sometimes accused of being just as violent and dangerous as the men they run down. Respected lawmen, or feared vigilantly, the motto of the Ranger is "Shoot first and shoot to kill."

This 26 page PDF brings you the world of the rangers. Where they live, how they work, and the enemies they hunt.

174678.name: Colecionando Offline
174678.description:
Make the most valuable games collection! Use the special powers of three characters - Pena (rolling two equal numbers), Poaiola (three) and Sergião (a sequence) - to earn games from stores or another players. If you have a complete game collection of a publisher, scores five points. If you have at least one game of each publisher, more five points. Extra copies loses 3 points.
This game was a "Jogando Offline - 2nd season" crownfounding's stretch goal.

174679.name: Hold Your Breath! 5/6 Player Expansion
174679.description:
In Hold Your Breath!, the game is played in two rounds. In the first round each player may dive deeper, providing they have the "Swim" and "Air" cards to do so. Players press their luck each turn since it is the pirate who dives the deepest in round one AND resurfaces in round two who is the winner. Players can play "Panic", "Shark" and other nasty cards on the other players, slowing their progress. In the second round each player struggles to reach the surface before they run out of air and therefore decide to take a rest (aka LOSE). Most of the pirates may not make it back to the surface, but the one who makes it back alive AND dove the deepest is the winner.

This expansion allows for up to two additional players to take a dive and press their luck.

174680.name: Play It Again Sam 2
videogameversion: English/European BBC Master Compact 3.5" Disc edition
English/European BBC Micro and Master Series 5 1/4" Disc edition
174680.description:
From the back of the box:

Sam, an ardent fan of Superior Software's games, has been absolutely delighted with the success of his first selection of chart-topping Superior Software games.
Now here's four more games that will keep you enthralled day after day - on that you can rely!

User Summary

This is the second release in Superior Software's popular series of Play It Again Sam compilations.

It includes four games:

Repton 3 - The third in the highly popular series inspired by Boulderdash. This version includes 24 pre-built levels and also a level editor and character designer.
Crazee Rider - A motorcycle racing game featuring 7 international racetracks.
Galaforce - A Galaga / Space Invaders style game.
Codename: Droid - The sequel to Stryker's Run, this is a graphically impressive run-and-gun.

174681.name: Elliot Moose Counting Game
174681.description: Elliot Moose Counting Game is a game designed to teach numbers and test memory for young children. It can be played three different ways. The main game is called "Elliot Moose Counting Board Game." In this game, players roll a die to move their pieces around a track around the outside edge of the board. When they land on a space, they take the tile depicting a number or objects. They must then choose a face-down tile from the middle with a number printed on it. If the number matches, they keep the pair. If it does not match, both tiles are returned to their places and the next player takes a turn. When all pairs are claimed, the game ends and the player with the most pairs wins. Players can also choose to play "Counting Memory," which plays similarly but with the die and track removed. Players simply choose a tile from a stack and try to pick the face-down number tile that matches the number of items depicted on the card. Another option is "Guess Which Number!" where one number tile is hidden, the other are placed face-down and players take turns guessing which number is missing.

174682.name: Wild Island Quest
174682.description:
User Summary

Wild Island Quest is about teenagers on a mysterious floating island. You will need to prepare for the trip and may take friends with You, but they each have their strengths and weaknesses. Enjoy the Island`s nature and face its inhabitants, while trying to last. Your actions and choices affect the outcome.

174683.name: Math Bingo
174683.description: Math Bingo is a twist on traditional Bingo designed to reinforce basic arithmetic skills. In this game, each player has a 4x4 card with a series of numbers. A caller reads a series of math problems (either addition and subtraction for younger children or multiplication and division for older). Players must solve the math problem and mark a space on their card corresponding to the answer. Once a player completes a row or column and claims bingo, the caller checks the math to make sure their answers are correct. If so, they are declared the winner. If not, incorrect answers are removed from the card and play continues until a player completes a row or column of correct answers.

174684.name: Emmanuelle
174684.description:
Game Manual
Adapted from EMMANUELLE Arsan's famous novel, here is a game which will take your breath away, situated in the heart of Brazil which is both luxuriant and enchanting.

Source: Wikipedia, "Emmanuelle (video game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.
The character Emmanuelle in the game is a wife of French business man whose job requires constant travelling, thus leaving his wife unfulfilled. Emmanuelle has taken a lover, Marc, but later suffers pangs of conscience, because she still loves her husband. Emmanuelle travels to Rio de Janeiro in Brazil, to escape him, but is followed by Marc. The aim of the game is to augment Marc's erotic potential so he can seduce Emmanuelle again.

The player's 'erotic potential' is increased by following the three laws of eroticism: law of numbers (seduce as much ladies as you can), law of asymmetry (try to seduce an odd number of ladies) and a law of surprise (seduce preferably concealed/masked ladies). Furthermore, the player should find three erotique statuettes. There's not any hardcore scenes present in the game, but Marc might catch Emmanuelle disrobing while looking through a certain keyhole, although more often he will see only an old gentleman washing his feet.

174685.name: The Great Dreidel Race!
174685.description: The Great Dreidel Race is a roll-and-move game contained in The Great Big Box of Hanukkah Fun. Players use dreidels and playing pieces, rolling a die to move them along a track. Along the way, they may encounter a variety of spaces that will help or hinder them. Some spaces move the player forward or back, others may cause gain or loss of a turn, some move other players' dreidels, some offer shortcuts. When landing on a "spin" space, a player must spin his or her dreidel and move to the space corresponding to the Hebrew letter spun. If a player lands on another player's dreidel, the other player is sent back to the nearest space marked with a candle. The first player to reach the finish space wins.

174686.description:
Shootin' Blanks is an easy to learn (less than 5 minutes) 2-8 player elimination card game that fits right in your pocket. Compete for fun, drinks, money or anything you want!

Each player begins the game with three lives. Use poker chips, pennies, dollars, pieces of paper, beers, etc. Be creative.

Deal three cards to each player (one at a time). Place the rest of the deck in the middle of the table to draw from throughout the game. Turn the top card of the draw pile over to begin the discard pile.

The player to the left of the dealer can draw the top card from the draw pile or the discard pile and then must discard a card on top of the discard pile. Continue clockwise around the table.

Players try to collect the highest possible hand value in the same color OR in the same number.

Play continues clockwise until a player bangs or the draw pile is exhausted. Players cannot bang on their first turn.

When a player believes their hand is better than at least one other players hand, they bang on the table (or say bang) during their turn instead of drawing and discarding.

All other players get to draw and discard one more time.

At the end of the round, players show and announce their hand value (only adding cards of the same color OR the same number, not both).
The player(s) with the worst hand lose one life.
When a player loses all three lives, they are eliminated from the game. The last person with a life wins.

If a player at any time during the game has three blank cards in their hand, they throw down their cards and yell "I'm Shootin’ Blanks!" The round ends and all other players lose one life. Blanks are worth 0.

If a High/Low card is ever face up in the discard pile prior to a player banging, the scoring for the round changes from high to low. You still calculate your high hand, but instead the player with the highest hand value loses a life (ties work the same way for low hand rounds). It is possible to switch from High to Low back to High back to Low in a single round. High/Low cards are worth 0 and can never be drawn from the discard pile.

Wild cards can be any color and any number 1 through 8. They cannot be Blanks or High/Low cards.
174686.name: Shootin' Blanks

174687.name: Hurry Home!
174687.description:
Hurry Home is a game designed to teach letter sounds to young children. It was published as part of a Scholastic Phonics Reading Program boxed set.

In Hurry Home, players must get Sound Hound home to his doghouse. Each player chooses a path, made up of a number of spaces marked with pictures, leading to the doghouse. Each player takes turns spinning a spinner marked with 0 to 3. The player then draws that number of cards from a stack of cards marked with words or pictures. The opposite side of the card shows the first letter of the picture or words. The player must then say the name of the pictured item or read the words (an adult facilitator may help with reading) and the say the letter. The player then looks at his or her path and places a marker on any picture that starts with that letter. If no matches can be found, the card is placed at the bottom of the pile. The first player to place marker on every space on his or her path brings Sound Hound home and wins the game.

174688.name: Radiant
boardgamepodcastepisode: Cult of the New Board Game Podcast Episode 028 – 10 Games for Essen
174688.description:
In the world of Perim there are four races: the Avis of the clouds, the Treefolk of the forest, the Stonedwellers of the mountains, and the Mariners of the sea. Each has evolved abilities needed to dominate its realm. But in every age, one is blessed. One is Radiant.

In Radiant, players draft an army of warriors and battle for control. Points are scored for melds, conquering regions, controlling majorities, and capturing opposing units. Players mount knights, activate assassins, and order their Radiant to spread their dominion.

At its core, Radiant is an area-control trick-taking game in which the winning suit, or race, is determined by a battle's location on a game board. The Radiant race is capable of competing in every region. At the beginning of each round, or age, players are dealt a hand of 8 to 10 cards, and then draft four additional cards which represent the units in their army. After melding card sets, players move a pawn on the game board to determine a battle's location. Players win battles to claim control over regions and for the right to choose the next battle's location.

Valuable temples and useful portals add excitement to the board. At the end of each age, the board is replenished with victory points waiting to be claimed, creating an asymmetrical board for the second and third ages.

Prove your power in the ages of the Radiant

174689.name: Fishing Camp
174689.description:
From the rules:
The object of Fishing Camp - To be the first person to travel from the docks, catch a fish or multiple fish, and get back to the docks with their catch.

Fishing Camp is a roll-and-move fishing trivia game in which player move along a track trying to catch a fish before reaching the home space. All player start out at the dock with a fishing boat playing piece. They choose a level of difficulty from 1 to 4 for their questions. This is a way to handicap the game. Older or more experienced fishermen should choose a higher number.

Each player in turn rolls the die and moves along a track marked with lily pads. Green lily pads are safe spots. On a yellow (or orange) lily pad, the player must choose a question card and answer a fishing trivia question at their level. A decoder (transparent red plastic) is used to reveal the answer. If the answer is correct, the player rolls and moves again. If the card depicts a fish, the player keeps it and has now made a catch. If the card says so, the player may take the GPS card (of which there is only one), which may allow him or her to take a shortcut along the path. Purple cards may move the player to "Shore Lunch Island" or other locations, possibly delaying him or her. The first player to move completely around the track and reach a "Home" space with at least one caught fish wins the game. However, if a player finished without a fish, he or she may move immediately to "Last Chance Launch" and move toward the home space from there, attempting to catch a fish along the way.

174690.name: Strange Conversations
174690.description:
Strange Conversations is a humorous social game for 3 to 7 players that tests players' abilities to convey hints about their secret identities to one another throughout the course of a simple role-played sit-down conversation.

In each game players find themselves in an interesting hypothetical setting and scenario having a conversation with a group of people with strange and often funny personality quirks.

At the start of each round, each player is assigned a secret JOB and a secret character QUIRK. For example, a player may be an olympic athlete (job) whose hands keep getting stuck to the table (quirk). Or, a doctor (job) who offers other players back-handed compliments (quirk). Or, a dancing instructor (job) who is hitting on other players (quirk).

With inspiration from a random scenario, players role-play a discussion and provide clues to each other about what their two qualities (job/quirk) are.

There are no "turns" in this game. Conversations are free-flowing discussions where players may ask and answer questions whenever appropriate. Players drop creative hints about their identities through the use of verbal hints, including puns and keywords related to their jobs, hints to aspects of their jobs, and cultural references. Players may also use physical gestures to help convey their identities.

Players earn the most points if they can signal what their jobs and quirks are to some -- but not all -- other players, and also earn points for guessing who other players are.

174691.name: Noteworthy
174691.description:
Noteworthy is a card game that teaches "ear training" by prompting players to race to arrange cards with musical notes on them while listening to a melody played by the Noteworthy Game app.

The fastest players to arrange their scores get bonuses before scoring points based on the accuracy of the notes and timing of the melody. The player with the highest score wins!

Each card has a single note (A-G) that can be modified in length based on how cards overlap each other (including cards that mark rests in the music). The arrangement of these cards represents the melody that players are trying to perfectly match.

174692.name: Pasaporte Ecuador
174692.description:
The best mix of Trivia with multiple choise answers, mimic, sounds, challenges and more fun stuff about Ecuador with unique handcrafted tokens made with tagua "vegetal ivory".

The goal is to become the Embassador of Ecuador by being the first to seal the passport.

It´s a unique way to gather again with your family and friends while you travel around your country.

174694.name: Ujub või Upub kaardimäng
174694.description:
There are 36 cards in Ujub või Upub kaardimäng (Floats or sinks cardgame).
Some of the items on the cards float, some sink if on water.
The cards are turned around one by one and player who first shouts correctly floats of sinks wins the card as a point.
If the deck is exhausted the player with the most cards is the winner.

174695.description:
Cargotrain Duel is a promotional board game which serves to promote the full game Cargotrain. The game is just a double sided sheet of paper with instructions on one side and the board on the other.

Each player manages a fleet of trains. The goal of the game is to gather most points. On a player's turn she rolls five dice. Then the players takes alternatively one dice each other, starting with the active player untill both take two. The last 5th die is a support die.

The active player moves first. She chooses wich die will be the resource die and which will be the route die. Then she takes an amount of resources equal to the sum of resource and support dice. Now she can move a train on route which corresponds to route die. In order to do that she must spend her resources in amount indicated on route fields. If a player reaches or passes through a field with factory, then

When both players took their turns there is a scoring round. Each player scores the points indicated on the route fields, on which their trains are staying now.
174695.name: Cargotrain Duel

174696.name: Hexx & Hopp
174696.description:
The players try to create a structure on the table as quick as possible using 13-15 hexagonal tiles each. At least 2 sides must match when adding a new tile. To make matters worse, each player can only see one of his tiles at a time. There are 72 different tiles, each with 6 different colored triangles in red, yellow, blue and white, and each color can occur up to 3 times on a tile.

If you place a tile that's adjacent to 3 other tiles, you give 2 of your tiles to the other players. If you match 4 then you give 4 tiles, and if you match 5 then you give 6 tiles. Whenever you place a tile you must say loudly the number of adjacent tiles.

When a player finishes placing the tiles, everyone stops and counts their points: tiles still in hand are negative points. The player with the fewest negative points after an agreed number of rounds wins.

174697.name: Singstar Party Hits
174697.description:
User Summary

Singstar Party Hits was the first Australian/New Zealand only release of Singstar and had a few Australian pop artists.

The game provided new tracks but no new features to the Singstar formula.

174698.name: SingStar Hottest Hits
174698.description:
User Summary
A karaoke game released in the SingStar series. Gameplay is similar to the other titles of the series.

From the back of the box
30 Original Tracks and Music Videos*

original videos used where possible

174699.name: Arcane School Sub-Domains (New Sub-Domains)
174699.description:
From publisher blurb:

This issue introduces several cleric sub-domains based on arcane schools. All are associated with the Magic domain, but many fall under other domains as well such as the Necromancy sub-domain that works well as both a Magic sub-domain and Death sub-domain.

New domain powers are introduced, many suggested from the school powers granted to wizards though with a clerical flair.

174700.name: Mythic Jewels
174700.description:
From publisher blurb:

Mythic Jewels is our latest Mythic Mini devoted to mythic magic items that create unique mythic effects. Some can be used only by mythic wearers, while others are useful for all characters but have effects enhanced or new abilities unlocked in the hands of mythic wielders. Mythic Jewels brings you 3 brand-new items: the crown of iron sorcery, diamond of everwinter, and force shield pin!

174701.name: Eldritch Knight
174701.description:
From publisher blurb:

This edition of “Fantastic Feats” – a series of feats based around a certain theme or subject – is about the prestige class Eldritch Knight, those warriors and spell casters combined.

The feats you'll find inside:

Eldritch Charm - Impress the nobles and others with your personality
Eldritch Guidance - Guide your hand in combat
Eldritch Protection - Use yoour arcane energy to help protect yourself
Eldritch Prowess - Use arcane forces to improve your effectiveness
Eldritch Skill - Your skill level is buffed
Eldritch Speed - The first hit in combat can be the most important
Eldritch Strike - Hit harder at a cost of spell power

174702.name: Bizantium and the Northern Islands
174702.description:
From publisher blurb:

To the civilized world, Bizantium and the waters and lands around its are frightening. A realm of sea serpents, monsters, and barbarians. To the heroes and people who live there, it is a realm of adventure, beauty and opportunity.

One might consider Bizantium as the center of adventure and mystery in the North. Many are the myths of ancient gods, lost treasures and strange creatures. On the mainland, there are the Wolfen and their canine kin, the Kiridin barbarians, the turbulent Shadow Coast colonies, and all manner of monsters and secrets in the Northern Hinterlands and Great Northern Mountains. Living near the edge of the Sea of Despair and in the shadow of the Land of the Damned, sea monsters and danger are but a short voyage away and make all too frequent a visit to the Bizantium islands.

North of Bizantium is the Icy Ocean and Great Ice Shelf, places where only a handful of the bravest Bizantian sailors have ever set sail, and the rest of the world knows nothing about. For kingdoms in the south, only a few scholars have ever heard of the Great Ice Shelf or the cannibalistic Necromancers known as the Iceborn who make the frozen wasteland their home. Those who have heard tales of the land of ice and death are convinced they are nothing but the stuff of myth. Very soon, they will find out otherwise.

And these are but a few of the revelations presented in Bizantium and the Northern Islands™. Discover for yourself the wonders and horrors that await.

Waterchanter O.C.C. and 20+ magic spells new to the Fantasy setting.
Necromancy revisited. Many spells new to the Fantasy setting.
90+ spells in all, including Ocean Magic for the Waterchanter, Necromancy and more.
Serpent Chaser, Bizantium Marine and other new character classes.
The Iceborn, their man-eating Raiders, Skinbinders and Sea Witches. A forgotten race of monsters who worship death, wield death magic, hunt humanoids, eat their flesh, and wear their skin. A villain you will love to hate.
The Iceborn’s Necroilus – massive vessels made from the remains of dead sea serpents and animated by Necromancy to prowl the seas.
Vengeful gods, monsters, Sea Serpents and Sea Monster creation tables.
The Seven Treasures touched by the Northern Gods, lost for centuries, waiting to be found.
New and old Bizantium ships including the Bireme, Ice Breaker and Battleship.
Bizantium as never before seen.
The Northern Islands described in new detail.
The Great Ice Shelf – a new continent to explore.
Bizantium’s origin, history, and mysteries revealed.
Bizantian society, culture, religion, magic and notable places.
People and places of note. Adventure hooks galore, and more.

174703.description: Dungeons & Dragons: Attack Wing – Gold Dwarf Cleric Expansion Pack includes one pre-painted miniature, upgrade cards and tokens.
174703.name: Dungeons & Dragons: Attack Wing – Gold Dwarf Cleric Expansion Pack
boardgamefamily: Dungeons & Dragons: Attack Wing Miniatures Game

174704.description: Dungeons & Dragons: Attack Wing – Darkenbeast Expansion Pack includes one pre-painted miniature, upgrade cards and tokens.
174704.name: Dungeons & Dragons: Attack Wing – Darkenbeast Expansion Pack
boardgamefamily: Dungeons & Dragons: Attack Wing Miniatures Game

174705.description: Dungeons & Dragons: Attack Wing – Copper Dragon Expansion Pack includes one pre-painted miniature, upgrade cards and tokens.
174705.name: Dungeons & Dragons: Attack Wing – Young Copper Dragon Expansion Pack
boardgamefamily: Dungeons & Dragons: Attack Wing Miniatures Game

174706.name: Oquonie
videogamehonor: 2015 IGF Awards Excellence In Visual Art Nominee
174706.description:
Oquonie is a textless puzzle game for iPad and iPhone created in collaboration with illustrator Rekka Bellum where you must find your way across an intertwined megastructure. You will not be alone, your incarnations will have the help of bizaroid characters speaking an obscure language.

Source: The Developer Website.

174707.name: Smudge & the Moonies
174707.description:
User Summary

A game where you have to ride your bicycle and fly your jet pack whilst avoiding strange, bouncing baddies, with the goal of sweeping everyone's chimneys.

Once a chimney has been swept, you need to return to the laundrette to clean yourself up, before setting out on another chimney sweeping mission!

174708.name: Infinite Aliens
174708.description:
From publisher blurb:

Alien life forms have been a core feature of science fiction since the genre was conceived. Since then the human mind has dreamed up countless speculations about what these creatures might look like and how they might interact with us. Not only has science fiction inspired us to daydream about meeting beings from another planet, we have also created alien heroes to admire and emulate.

The Infinite Aliens book 1 is a resource for gamers who want to create custom aliens for use as player characters and adversaries within the Infinite Futures game system. This book has everything you need to bring unique alien races to life in your science fiction campaign. Any type of creature you can imagine can be brought to life is just a few simple steps.

Infinite Aliens serves as guide to provide gamers with all the tools they need to create their own alien races. The book has step-by-step instructions that explain how to make a balanced, ready to play race using the Infinite Futures rules. The creation guidelines found in this book can be easily imported into other game systems, allowing players and GMs the opportunity to introduce these novel beings into any science fiction universe.

174709.name: Infinite Aliens 2
174709.description:
From publisher blurb:

Alien life forms have been a core feature of science fiction since the genre was conceived. Since then the human mind has dreamed up countless speculations about what these creatures might look like and how they might interact with us. Not only has science fiction inspired us to daydream about meeting beings from another planet, we have also created alien heroes to admire and emulate.

Infinite Aliens 2 present ten fully detailed alien races for use in your Infinite Futures games. Used as either a player character race or as an NPC, these great aliens will fit well in just about any sort of game.

174710.description:

174713.description:
