Soon the medusae will emerge from the subterranean homes to conquer the surrounding desert.

Inside you’ll find:

A brief history of the realm.
An insight into medusae hibernation.
An exploration of the many hazards that await explorers.
A look at the medusae’s military.
10 new locations to explore, including the Grand Temple of Ss’essliss and the Valley or the Oracle.
1 new major NPC.
Ideas for why heroes may visit the Realm of the Medusae and adventure seeds.
1 new minor deity – Handarsaga, the god of stasis.
2 new monsters and guidelines for creating variant medusae.
Notes for the GM on how to create living statues and stone golems.

174885.name: The Snakelands of Old
174885.description:
From publisher blurb:

For two millennia the snakemen of old have been spoken of only as ghosts, for it has long been known they were destroyed by the armies of mighty Hekata. If only such tales were true. Entering a state of self-imposed exile, the ophidae have waited patiently for the signal for them to emerge once and rebuild their once glorious empire. At long last the stars have aligned. Nomads in the surrounding regions sense a dark presence in the Snakelands, and fear once again sweeps across the desert. The serpent is on the ascent.

Inside you’ll find:

A new Professional Edge – Snake Charmer.
Information on ophidae society and their views on racial purity.
An overview of the many hazards that await explorers.
9 new locations to explore, including the City of the Firmament and the Whispering Oasis.
3 new major NPCs.
A new festival honoring Shamash, god of the sun.
Ideas for why heroes may visit the Snakelands and adventure seeds.
Details on Ss’esslis, the god of the ophidae, and Ningirama, deity of protection from snakes.
4 new monsters.

174886.name: Jubbah, City of Monkeys
174886.description:
From publisher blurb:

Unknown to the outside world yet claiming to exist for millennia, and populated by talking simians mentioned in no musty records, until recently Jubbah was isolated from the outside world by its fearful citizens. Slowly, it has to come to accept its part in the greater world, and its gates are now open to traders and sightseers of other races. Come now and explore Jubbah, City of Monkeys!

Inside you’ll find:

Origins of the city and the talking simians known as the Babu.
Notes on the unusual city’s social hierarchy, educational system, religion, military, law and order, trade, and architecture.
8 locations within the city walls.
4 new major NPCs.

174887.name: The Al-Wazir Sultanate
174887.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome one and all to the Al-Wazir Sultanate, the physical manifestation of Suleiman’s dream! For just a few dinars this marvellous guide book will detail the many delights of our great cities, introduce you to many illustrious persons, and explore our wise and benevolent culture! Within these pages you will find stories of danger and glory, learn about the mysterious jinn, and find fuel enough for any imagination! This great and wondrous tome is divided into three section for your reading pleasure.


Introduction

This 14 page section covers general information concerning the Sultanate and its people. Inside you’ll find details on Social Hierarchy, Education, Religion, Military, Law & Order, Trade & Tribute, Major Locales , and Persons of Note.


The Cities

Each of the nine great cities receives 8 dedicated pages. We cover the same topics above, but with a specific focus on how they apply with each city. Hundreds of new locations provide you with plenty of places to visit, explore, and shop! Dare you brave the House of Screams? Do you have the coin to shop in the Jinn Market? Will you enlist at the University of the Arcane?


The Pegasus Guard

This two page section expands the material on the Sultan’s elite Pegasus Guard, with information for GMs and players alike! As an added bonus, the Sultan has permitted us to discuss the bloodlines of his pegasi.


Sidebars

But there is yet more, oh noble master of the golden coin! The author has provided further information through the use of sidebars! Here are such thing as universities (and how heroes can enrol on courses), three new magical Arcane Backgrounds, rules and advice covering libraries, hiring sages, working for a living, and scribing tomes of lore, as well as information on the lesser jinn and thieves guilds.

174888.name: The Caliphate of Al-Shirkuh
174888.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome one and all to the Caliphate of Al-Shirkuh, a land where the Faithful have found paradise! For just a handful of lowly coins this marvelous guide book will detail the many delights of our great cities, introduce you to many illustrious persons, and explore our enlightened and benevolent culture! Within these pages you will find stories of danger and glory, learn about those who honor the gods, and find fuel enough for any imagination! This great and wondrous tome is divided into three section for your reading pleasure.


Introduction

This 14 page section covers general information concerning the Caliphate and its people. Inside you’ll find details on Social Hierarchy, Education, Religion, Military, Law & Order, Trade & Tribute, Major Locales , and Persons of Note.


The Cities

Each of the eight great cities receives 8 dedicated pages. We cover the same topics above, but with a specific focus on how they apply with each city. Hundreds of new locations provide you with plenty of places to visit, explore, and shop! Will you browse the Little Shop of Horus or dine at Meet for Meat? Have you what it takes to enroll in the University of Healing and Herbalism? Or will you visit the Tower of Stars and gaze deep into the heavens?


The Brotherhood of Unfortunate Souls

This two page section expands the material on the Brotherhood of Unfortunate Souls, with information for GMs and players alike!


Sidebars

But there is yet more, oh wise and sublime friend of merchants! The author has provided further information through the use of sidebars! Here are such thing as the hierarchy of the temples, the cost of funerals, how to flatter people, punishments for criminal acts, religious wares, new herbal remedies, new Edges, and different types of coffee and tabac for those with discerning tastes.

174889.name: The Free Emirate States
174889.description:
From publisher blurb:

Of the three great human realms, it is the Free Emirate States that actually comes closest to fulfilling Suleiman’s vision. Only a fool would deny there are problems, but here at least citizens of both creeds live side by side in peace in harmony. For the most part, people are judged by their skills, not the method in which they choose to worship the higher powers. The Emirates holds much promise, for here anyone can rise to a position of great influence and authority. So welcome, noble traveler, to a realm that boasts of being a gateway to both the deserts of Al-Shirkuh and the frozen land of Rassilon.


Introduction

This 10 page section covers general information concerning the Emirates and its people. Inside you’ll find details on Social Hierarchy, Education, Religion, Military, Law & Order, Trade & Tribute, Major Locales , and Persons of Note.


The Cities

Each of the six great cities receives 8 dedicated pages. We cover the same topics above, but with a specific focus on how they apply with each city. Dozens of new locations provide you with plenty of places to visit, explore, and shop! Will you search for the Tombs of the Thief Lords? Does the dust of the desert need washing away at the Marid’s Fountain? Perhaps you waould care to meet the natives of Jinn Town?


The Guild of Headsmen

This two page section expands the material on the Guild of Headsmen, with information for GMs and players alike!


Sidebars

But there is yet more, oh benificent master of the golden coin! The author has provided further information through the use of sidebars! Here are such thing as the types of clothing found in Al-Shirkuh, a guide to cleanliness, a discussion on who or what created the relics, typical soldiers and the cost of hiring an army, common phrases involving the jinn, and new Edges.

174890.name: Sewers 2
174890.description:
From publisher blurb:

This full color battlemap is the 243rd of a series featuring various terrains. This installment of the battlemap series features some variations of a fantasy sewer tunnel.

The individual variations of the map are 7 x 10 squares in size, with each 1 inch square scaled to represent 5 feet. They are provided as a single segment each, in a single PDF using the letter format. The individual variations can be assembled into a longer sewer tunnel.

The product has been updated to include gridless JPG images of the map, intended for use with VTT software. They are 1008x1440 pixels in size at 144dpi.

174891.name: Mage Wars Arena: Promo Pack 01
174891.description:
Promo Pack expansion with new spells available in Arcane Wonders Store.

Components:
Equipment
- Leviathan Scale Armor (x2)
- Storm Drake Hide (with new art)
- Spiked Armor
- Ring of Healing

Incantation
- Holy Strike
- Teleport (x4, with new art)

Enchantments
- Bear Strength (with new art)
- Debilitate
- Plagued

Conjurations
- Altar of the Iron Guard
- Gravikor

Creatures
- Bloodwave Greatbow
- Kumanjaren Leopard
- Selesius, the East Wind (with new art)
- Victorian Griffin
- Temple High Guard

174892.name: Mah Jongg: Card Game
174892.description:
Millions of players and fascinated by Mah Jongg, the enchanting game of luck and skill. Now, instead of using heavy and very expensive tiles, you can experience the game with these beautiful custom designed cards!

Unlike in regular Mah Jongg, this card game starts each round with a "Charleston", where each player simultaneously gives 3 cards to the player on their right, then 3 cards to the player opposite, then 3 cards to the player on their left.

The aim of the game is to call Mah Jongg, by collecting 3 sets of 4 identical cards, and a pair. Again, this is different from regular Mah Jongg where sets of 3 and runs of 3 are also collected.

174893.description:
TROLL, published by Oink Games in 2015, is a revised version of Dragon Teeth Washer, originally published by Drosselmeyer in 2012. In TROLL, each player takes the role of a thief, trying to steal precious jewels from the hideous troll.

At the beginning of the game, each player receives a set of six tokens, with numbers from 0 to 5. Depending the number of the players, some troll cards are not used (Troll cards have values 3, 5, 7, 9, 11, 13, and 15). On a round, players attempt to steal from the target troll by playing his or her tokens in sequence. The first player secretly looks at the target troll (the top troll card) and plays one of his number tokens face up. If he or she plays a "3" token, it means that the player intends to steal 3 jewels from the target troll. Next players have two options: 1) look at the troll card just as the first player did and play a number token face up; or 2) play a number token face down, take a multiplier (x2) token from the pool, and put the multiplier token on his or her face down number token.

After all the players played their number tokens, the troll card is revealed. Beginning from the player who played the lowest card, add up the value of the number tokens. Suppose that the troll is "9" and Amy played "3", Becky "5", Carlos "2", and Dave "3" with "x2" multiplier on it, Carlos (2), Amy (3), and Dave (3) are entitled to receive 2, 3, and 6 (3x2) jewels respectively. However, Becky will receive a penalty point (-2), since she woke up the troll. 9 is bigger than 2+3+3 but it is smaller than 2+3+3+5. Becky triggered the troll's rampage.

Play continues in this manner for a specified number of rounds/days (set of rounds), depending the number of the players. The player with the most jewels at the game end is the winner.
174893.name: TROLL
boardgamepodcastepisode: Garrett's Games 481 - Meeplefest Night 2, Part 3

174894.name: Ritual
174894.description:
Now is your chance. The kingdom is falling to ruin. The land has stopped producing food, the populace is starving, and the king is powerless to help. No longer relegated to the shadows you and other Necromancers like you may emerge; offering understanding and defeat over death itself to the fearful people in exchange, merely, for their unquestioning and total obedience.

Your goal is to destroy all your opponents' villages and be the last necromancer left alive. Utilize the deaths of your enemies’ servants or even sacrifice your own to fuel your dark magic. Use your cards to build up your villages and summon afflictions and monstrosities to set upon, attack, and destroy your opponents’. You win when every other player is undead. Become the last in power and leave destruction in your wake. Nevertheless, beware your fallen foes--for, as a Necromancer, death is but a tool.

In Ritual, you always have a chance to come back and steal the win. It’s a fun and unpredictable cutthroat card game for 3-5 players which is easy to learn and quick to play, yet offers significant strategic depth. How can you best use the cards you've drawn? Who shall you attack first? When will you make your final move and crush all who oppose you?

174895.description: North Cape: Convoy Battles in the Arctic, 1942-45 is a simulation of the convoy battles fought in the Barents Sea during World War Two. The game is played in several scenarios, each of which simulates one of the historical convoy battles in the Arctic. Each side must attempt to find and locate enemy positions and complete their missions. The objective in the game for the German player is to sink the largest number of enemy merchant ships possible. For the Allied player, the objective of the game is to bring the greatest number of merchant ships to the Soviet Union.
174895.name: North Cape: Convoy Battles in the Arctic, 1942-45

174896.name: Deadzone: Marauders Faction Starter
174896.description: The Marauders were trained by the Corporation as shock troops and guards, but that’s in the past - since the Mandrake Rebellion they’ve become the terror of the shipping lanes. They strike out at the GCPS with the very weapons with which they were outfitted, combining well-honed battle drill with brute force and low cunning. A Deadzone presents a great opportunity – a chance to both pillage for supplies and take a shot at their erstwhile employers.

174897.name: Deadzone: Rebs Faction Starter
174897.description: The free-thinkers, anarchists and dissidents of the Corporation will always find a home with the Rebellion. They do not stand alone, either; the galaxy is large and full of life, and most races have reasons to hold a grudge against the GCPS. Coordinating their efforts from hidden bases deep in unoccupied space, Rebs raid isolated outposts to build stocks of munitions and technology, hoping one day to have the strength to stand up wholesale against the oppressive rule of the Council of Seven.

174898.name: Chronology
174898.description:
Chronology is an episodic puzzle-platform adventure where you defy time by manipulating the past and the future, in order to fix the present. Play as the Old Inventor and his sidekick The Snail, and take advantage of their special abilities - travel back and forth in time, stop time, manipulate objects and solve puzzles.

Source: The Developer Website.

174899.name: Le Guide des Joueurs
174899.description:
User Summary

Rediscover the old classics of RPG in a system inspired by the works of Gygax, Arneson, Holmes, Modvay and Mentzer. This game allow you play the usual classes in a world where various races live together.

This books cover rules for characters up to level 14.

174900.name: Hill Cantons Compendium II
174900.description:
From publisher blurb:

Being a Collection of Player Options and House Rules Various and Sundry for Classic Fantasy Role-playing Games Old and Dear.

What you will find inside:

Nine variant old school fantasy (and Labyrinth Lord)-compatible player classes: the Mountebank, Chaos Monk, Robo-Dwarf, Feral Dwarf, White Wizard, Half-Ogre, Black “Halflings”, Pantless Barbarian and, of course, the War Bear.
Setting overview and whoha for the Hill Cantons world,
Character background mini-game/alternative generator with quick random equipment charts.
Zero-level character generation and play rules.
Variant rules for simple attribute checks.

174901.name: Anagramix
174901.description:
Anagram is a type of word play, the result of rearranging the letters of a word or phrase to produce a new word or phrase.
On this game a card is drawn. All players, at the same time, should try to write as many words as they can using all the letters that are shown in the card. Whoever makes more words, gains more points!
Some words are easy to make, but there are others that will demand more knowledge and memory effort from your part.
A very dynamic and challenging game where you will want to defy your knowledge every time a new card is drawn.

174902.name: An (un)Deathly Storm
174902.description:
From publisher blurb:

An (un)Deathly Storm is the first in an upcoming series of one page adventures by Sacrosanct Games. They are designed with the following goals in mind:

Meant to be one-off sessions whenever something comes up that you can't do your main campaign
generic in listed stats to be compatible with most versions of the most popular RPG with little conversion needed.
a quick, low prep adventure for whenever the desire to game grabs you
keep it to only one page in length for ease of use and printing

174904.name: Cyber8s: The Slag Heap
174904.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Slag-Heap is a three-story tall entertainment venue located in the center of the massive Lonely J scrapyard. As one approaches the Lonely J from the road they can see nothing but towering walls of crushed vehicles. It is only when a person reaches the gated entrance that they notice something strange. The driveway acts as a perfect bottleneck by forcing all traffic into a single file. On the right is a poorly hidden assault cannon trained on the gates and a pair of heavily armored guards patrols the opening.

It is only after one is allowed to pass through the yards rusty gates that they begin to feel the deep rumble of powerful speakers from further in the scrapyard. The vibrations threaten to send the wreckage spires tumbling down at any moment. Strange flickering lights and powerful strobe lights create deep shadows across the yard and conceal all manner of hidden danger.

Cyber8s The Slag Heap is a cyberpunk location for use with the Crazy 8s Rules-Lite Universal Game Engine and the Cyber8s setting expansion. This sourcebook provides multiple adventure hooks for a Cyber8s game and introduces a new setting.

174905.name: Servants of the Succubae
174905.description:
From publisher blurb:

Hell's Henchmen Chapter 8: Servants of the Succubae features:

10 all-new Hellspawn including Animals and Magical Beasts
Background of the Succubae, demon masters of seduction.




Inside this supplement you will find the following Hellspawn:

Cerberi - three-headed guard dogs of the Succubae.
Draco - sizable lizards that strongly resemble dragons of legend.
Khereb - chimera combination creatures utilized by the Succubae.
Serpents of Eden -immense snakes capable of speech and seduction.
Sphinx - a unique magical beast. With the body of a lion, wings of an eagle, and the head of a woman.
Unicorn - a great ploy by the Succubae, evil temptation hidden beneath an innocent facade.
Venom Claw - miniature winged jaguars that act as servants to the Succubae.
Layabouts - sloth given form.
Vopid - a mischecious ape-like creature.
Whisper Crow - messengers and spies, Whisper Crows make up a large portion of the information network shared by demons.




Expand your existing Contagion game, take your first steps into the war between Heaven and Hell or use these new and horrifying creatures in your favorite fantasy, horror, modern or future campaign. Hell's Henchmen utilizes material from the 3.5 revision of the OGL.

174906.name: Inferno
174906.description:
From publisher blurb:

The world of Contagion is a dark and terrifying place. Hellspawn and monsters of various stripes walk the earth, hunting, feeding from and exploiting humanity. Humans, far from innocent, perpetuate unspeakable evils onto one another for fun, profit, or simply because they don’t know any better.

While some of these people may avoid punishment and accounting for their transgressions throughout life, all are eventually judged.

Those whose souls are found wanting are condemned to be punished in Hell.

Inferno is a sourcebook that details the history of the Demonic Host and the realm of Hell. Learn what sins or trespasses all but guarantee Damnation. Discover the fate of Damned Souls.

Whether running a campaign full of PC Demons or a group of brave adventurers who wish to descend into the Void, Inferno gives you ecverything you need to take your game into the realm of the Damned. Abandon all hope, ye who enter here!

Inferno utilizes a modified version ofthe 3.5 OGL. All material can be easily adapted to your existing OGL game, however Inferno is designed to function within the world of the Contagion RPG.

Inferno includes:

A new realm for your Contagion game: Hell.
Rules for entering Hell, whether as Angels, Demons, living creatures or Damned Souls.
New Racial features for Angels and Demons while they are in the Void.
Expanded rules for combat in Hell.
Ruled for Damned Souls, those who have died and been sentenced to eternity in Hell.
Detailed information on the nine circles of Hell and the Demons who manage them.
Updates information on the politics of the Fallen Host, including the current fate of Azmodeus and a mystery regarding Lucifer...
Ten new Feats.
Twelve new Spells
Twenty-seven pre-generated characters for immediate use in your Contagion game, including Demons of all eight castes and members of the half-demon Immunda race.
An expanded spell list for the Infernalist class.

174907.name: Contagion Survival Guide
174907.description:
From publisher blurb:

The world of Contagion is a dark and terrifying place. On the surface, it looks much like the world you and I live in. Just beneath that surface, in the shadows, rages an ancient conflict between supernatural factions who all seek dominion over the Earth and control over the souls of humanity.

While most humans go about their daily lives unaware of the conflicts that surround them, some few people learn the frightening truth that monsters are real. Faced with the horrors of the supernatural world, some go insane. Others turn to religion or the occult to try and find some means of defending themselves from things that go bump in the night.

Some arm themselves to fight back against the darkness.

The Contagion Survival Guide is a weapons and tactics manual for use with Contagion Second Edition. Within these pages you will find game and setting information for weapons, armor, combat tactics and wilderness survival. There is also a section dedicated to rumors and theories regarding the supernatural. Apart from the introduction and the game statistics provided for items, this book is presented from the point of view of an arms dealer operating in the world of Contagion. This character, DMZ Dan, is a human veteran who is aware of the supernatural and has elected to do his part in the fight against monsters by ensuring that humans in the know are as well armed as possible.

The rumors, tactics, weapon descriptions and rants presented in this are told from the point of view of one man in a world gone awry. Gamemasters and players should be prepared to take everything herein with a grain of salt. Ol’ DMZ Dan just might be wrong about a thing or two. Of course, he could be spot on…

Contagion Survival Guide includes:

Game statistics and detailed descriptions of OVER 100 firearms for use with Contagion Second Edition
Dozens of Archaic, Missile, Exotic and non-lethal weapons
Game statistics and detailed descriptions of OVER 80 improvised weapons for use with Contagion Second Edition
Expanded options for armor and other wearable gear
A list of common edible and poisonous plants.
New systems for weapon recoil and randomized hit locations.

174908.name: Freelance Traveller (Issue 62/63 - Feb/Mar 2015)
rpgissuearticle: Doing It My Way: John Law IV: Ministry of Justice Character Generation for MegaTraveller
Doing It My Way: Star Legion Character Generation
In A Store Near You: Dress-Me-Up
Raconteurs’ Rest: A Compact Model, Part 1
The Shipyard: Hamtramck- and Viscount Rhyl-class Provincial Packets
Up Close and Personal: Badru Kiprotich
Up Close and Personal: Kyllikki Leppällä
174908.description:
From the Contents page:

Freelance Traveller #062/063: Feb/Mar 2015

Cover: Shawn Driscoll

Freelance Traveller is published monthly in PDF form by the editor. The current issue is available from Freelance Traveller's web site.

174909.name: Deadzone: Plague Faction Starter
174909.description: Bloodthirsty monsters created by an alien virus, the Plague exist for one thing only – to spread their contagion as far as possible. The virus affects its hosts in a variety of ways; its earliest victims become towering hulks, filled with a steadfast will which drives their lesser kin. In its second generation, the Plague creates smaller, faster, but no less deadly monsters. The third stage infected show considerably less extreme physical changes, but they retain the ability to use technology, laying down covering fire with looted weapons while their larger brethren advance.

174911.name: Surf Ninjas
videogameversion: North American SEGA Game Gear edition
174911.description:
From Game Box:

As Johnny Mcqueen, you've got a date with destiny. Return to Patu San and claim your birthright as its ruler!

174912.name: SAVAGE LANDS
174912.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – AVAILABLE




This game is still either in Early-Alpha or Beta (or any status in between) but IS already available for sale / early access, so CAN BE PLAYED.




Savage Lands is a gritty, brutal, first-person Open Fantasy World survival game. Players have one goal: Stay Alive. Explore a world where days and frigid nights are spent slaughtering vicious creatures, gathering scarce resources, building shelter, and crafting powerful weapons needed to survive.

Every decision counts. One mistake can mean permanent death.

Source: The Developer Website.

174913.name: Casus Belli (Special Issue 2 - 1990)
174913.description:
User Summary

Discover the mystic city of Laelith.

This special issue is a compilation of previously published material to describe Laelith the city of the God King, and its surroundings.

This is a ready made campaign setting for AD&D 1st Edition, and it is suitable for other fantasy RPGs.

174915.name: Export
174915.description:
The players are merchants and travel the game board to establish branches by moving through or to the red marked cities. Movement is determined by a die, but only the odd numbers count! When a player moves through the branch of another player, he takes posession of this branch. But the other player may take any one of the first players branches for compensation. When all branches are set, the players return to their sparting space.
Winning Points are awarded for singele branches, 3 branches in an area, 2 or more nighboring areas with 3 branches und the order of return to the starting space.

174916.name: Cities: Skylines
videogamehonor: 2015 Global Game Awards Best Management Game of the Year Winner
2015 Global Game Awards Game of the Year Nominee
2015 Golden Geek Best PC Game Nominee
2016 D.I.C.E. Strategy/Simulation Game of the Year Nominee
2016 Steam Awards Sit Back and Relax Nominee
174916.description:
Cities: Skylines is a modern take on the classic city simulation. The game introduces new game play elements to realize the thrill and hardships of creating and maintaining a real city whilst expanding on some well-established tropes of the city building experience. From the makers of the Cities in Motion franchise, the game boasts a fully realized transport system. It also includes the ability to mod the game to suit your play style as a fine counter balance to the layered and challenging simulation. You’re only limited by your imagination, so take control and reach for the sky!

Source: The Publisher Website.

174918.name: Rebel Galaxy
174918.description:
Rebel Galaxy is an action-packed, swashbuckling space opera. You’ll battle pirates, explore anomalies, befriend aliens, scavenge battle wreckage, mine asteroids, and discover artifacts. Choose your path as a roguish do-gooder, crafty space-trader or power-hungry privateer – or maybe a little of each! Buy larger and more powerful craft with your hard-earned credits, and outfit them with a variety of wicked weapons and defenses. Set in a galaxy of fantastic sights, and secrets to be found, Rebel Galaxy is above all a space epic of adventure, exploration, and combat.

Source: The Developer Website.

174919.name: Fury of Thringalesh
174919.description:
From the introduction:

Fury of Thringalesh is the second part of a three part series set in the world of Terra Minor. It is strongly recommended that your players complete part one, False Promises before beginning this adventure. The GM can skip part one and start this adventure, Fury of Thringalesh but will need to provide the players with considerable background details (see Adventure Background and Starting the Adventure for the background information).

This B/X adventure is designed for three to five adventurers ranging in level from 2nd to 4th. The GM is welcome to add or remove enemies to change the difficulty level for his or her group if necessary. The adventurer count is merely a recommended guideline; the GM can run this adventure with more or less players with minor modifications.

174920.name: Life is Strange: Episode 2 – Out of Time
174920.description:
User Summary

Continuing from Episode 1, Life Is Strange Episode 2 "Out of Time" sees Max (who has the power to reverse time) and Chloe attempt to discover more about Max's premonitions, the mystery of what Chloe's stepdad is up to and how to save Arcadia Bay.

174921.name: All The Kingdom's Men
174921.description:
Todos los Hombres del Reino (All the Kingdom's Men) is a Decktet playable game.

The players must ride around all the kingdom's regions.
The player who gains the favor of all the Lords wins the game.

The game is playable with Decktet but it has been redesigned for an easier game experience. It adds four new Decktet cards for an advanced game. You will also need several tokens and the Decktet chips.

To gain the favor of the region Lords, player must pay resources according to their travel cost. Then the region cards are activated and executed.

If no region can be activated, player must pass. Optionally, on his turn, player can ride, paying the cost of travel (one resource, with different types for each round).

To indicate that a region has been activated, it should be marked with a token; when a player has placed all his tokens in all the regions, he has won the game.

174922.name: The Red Dragon Inn: Allies – Halden the Unhinged
174922.description:
Halden is a totem-summoning shaman with an undying amount of work to do – his ghostly clientele provides him with plenty of unusual quests. Adventuring for the dead will take its toll on anyone. After all, wouldn’t you be a little off-kilter if you had to listen to restless spirits with unfinished business?


The Good: Halden can draw on the wisdom and power of countless lifetimes.



The Bad: His totems would like to remind you that he isn’t making up the voices in his head.


The Red Dragon Inn: Allies – Halden the Unhinged brings a totem shaman to The Red Dragon Inn. Will you be able to master chaining his totems to maximum effect, or will your totem combos whimper? Take this off-kilter adventurer for a spin and find out!

The Red Dragon Inn: Allies is a series of expansions for any standalone The Red Dragon Inn game. Each Allies set includes a single Character Deck, plus components to add a brand new character to your game.

174923.name: Cherry Tree High I! My! Girls!
174923.description:
User Summary

A linear visual novel and sequel to Cherry Tree High Comedy Club.

Mairu has succeeded in re-opening the school comedy club and must compete with a rival club for the spot of number one entertainment club, while her nemesis attempts to shut her club down.

174924.name: Heresy (2015)
174924.description:
User Summary

You play the role of a god who must influence, protect, and guide your followers in a medieval setting. Build villages, castles and defend them from raiders. You can possess your believers to take direct control over their actions.

174925.description:
Mr. Game! is a family-friendly party board game where one player has the power to create permanent rules during the game.

MECHANICS: Players use a simple roll-and-move system to navigate the board - roll two four-sided dice, choose one of the options, and move. If you land on a space with an ! on it, you draw a card from the game's singular tall stack of chaotic cards. The ultimate goal of the game is to land on the goal, but the goal can change places during the middle of the game if a special GOAL SWITCH Action card is drawn.

CARDS: There are three kinds of cards in Mr. Game! - Actions, Powerups, and Badges. If you draw an Action, you must play it immediately and discard it. If you draw a Powerup, you must play it immediately, but it stays in play and affects your character's natural abilities (sometimes positively, sometimes negatively). If you draw a Badge, you may play it whenever you want, and you are allowed to keep it concealed.

TILES: Many cards will bring Tiles into play. These small chipboard squares are essentially movable spaces that can be placed anywhere on the board. They change the layout of the board as soon as the enter play, adding spaces, removing spaces, or transfiguring spaces to have ridiculous, game-altering effects! They can be as simple as another ! space, or they can be as crazy as a Portal that transports you across the board!

MR. GAME: Before the game begins, someone must volunteer to be Mr. Game. (They can change their title, but the default is Mr. Game) Players must direct all questions to Mr. Game. This character is in charge of adding permanent rules to the game if the need arises. The game is purposely designed so that the core rules allow you to play but leave out specific details. Mr. Game's job is to fill in these details as the game goes on. The more creative Mr. Game is, the more fun everyone has! Other players at the table are encouraged to suggest ideas, but Mr. Game has the final say. If you don't like how they are "Mr. Game-ing", or they break one of the core tenets of being Mr. Game, just impeach them!

Mr. Game! is designed to be simple to learn. If you just read this entire description, you already know how to play! Oh, and if you have a question... well, ask Mr. Game!
174925.name: Mr. Game!

174926.description:
BECOME AN ANIMAL WIZARD! Wizards of the Wild is a game of sorcery and challenges! You roll the dice to acquire and power unique spells. Combine them together in a fast-paced, frenetic and friendly game!

Animal wizards battle in the ultimate magic contest at Stonehenge. Acolytes of the Lost Masters run the games, setting up many challenges and spells. But they also solicit bribes and punish contestants. The Acolytes will crown the winning contestant as King of the Forest!

In Wizards of the Wild, you'll use custom sorcery dice to build your powers, acquiring unique spells and overcoming difficult challenges. Scheme to find clever magical combinations, or even take the shadow path to put your opponents in a tricky bind!

Kickstarter Exclusive:
After Wizards of the Wild is released, the Deluxe Content will NOT be sold by Crosscut Games to distributors or retailers. A limited amount may be available through contests and promotional activities.

Deluxe Game Content List
- EVERYTHING in the Base Game PLUS....
- Baxel the Bear Player Board
- Mephisto Player Board
- Willow the Squirrel Player Board
- Rowena the Porcupine Player Board
- 9 Additional Spell Cards
- 7 Additional Challenge Cards
- 6 Additional Acolyte Cards
- Components for 5th player (5 Wooden Cubes + 2 Wooden Discs)

Base Game Content List:
- Rulebook
- 6 Player boards
- 36 Spell cards
- 36 Challenge cards
- 8 Acolyte cards
- 6 Custom Dice
- 28 Wooden Markers (20 Wooden Cubes + 8 Wooden Discs)
- 1 Score Board

The Collectors Edition is a Version of the Deluxe Edition that comes in a different game box and with additional accessories.

Collector's Edition Content List:
- EVERYTHING in the Deluxe Game PLUS....
- EXCLUSIVE Cherry Wood Collector's Box (Signed/Numbered)
- EXCLUSIVE Hand-Made First Player Wand
- 4 Large Velour Bags to lovingly hold all the cards (even while sleeved)
174926.name: Wizards of the Wild: Deluxe Edition

174927.name: Masterline
174927.description:
Designer/publisher : Jonathan BIZET
Artist : Gwen VIBANCOS
Rulewriter : Jérémie VUILLARD

MASTERLINE is a strategy game for 2 players. Goal is to align five complete gears of your own color.

Shuffle the deck and distribute 4 cards to each of the two players. The rest of the deck is left face down to form the stock pile. Draw the first card and put it face up between the players. The first player chooses the color of his gear (silver or copper), which will remains his color for the rest of the game.
At your turn, you draw a card, and place one card from your hand. These two phases (drawing and placing) are mandatory.

Below the type of the cards:

Padlock : cannot be rotated, even by a joker card
Rotation : identified by their arrows. Allow the player to rotate one adjacent card by a quarter turn in the arrow direction
Joker : purple cards. They bear both colors. When placed, they allow the player to rotate any card by a quarter turn. The color association between gears must always be respected when placing them.




When placing a card, you are free to decide whether to use its power or not.

174928.name: Injawara
174928.description:
Injawara is a project co-financed by European Union that aims at promoting Development Education among youth of different European countries.

In this cooperative game at the beginning of each turn a new challenge is drawn and placed in a specific continent of the world map gameboard. All the other kind of challenges that are in the same continent make the related indicators to low down in the development track. If one of this indicators reaches the skull space, the game is over and the team has lost.

The team each turn chooses one resource on the world map, and may use special actions provided by a resource, then, the team may move a resource and/or answer to a question in order to solve a challenge.
Each challenge require the presence of a specific resource in the same continent to be solved.

Solving a challenge makes the indicator of that challenge to move three spaces up, on the development track and removes the challenge from the word map.
Moreover it allows the team to unlock the power of that resource, now available to be used in the next rounds.

There are 6 different continents and 8 different kind of challenge (each one related to one of the 8 Millennium Development Goals).
If the team manages to solve at least a challenge per continent and at least one challenge per MDG, the game is over and points are scored depending on the position of the various indicators on the development track; the world is a better place now!

174929.name: Alien Frontiers: Galactic Pack
174929.description:
Upgrades the existing Alien Frontiers series to be equivalent to the extras included in the Alien Frontiers Big Box.

Contents:

1 Big Box (Empty)
1 Expanded Game Board (Double-Sided)
1 Expanded Outer Belt Board (Double-Sided)
2 Matter Extractor Alien Tech Cards
1 Special Relic Die
1 Special Relic Rocket Die
1 Brethren of the Stars Rocket Die
1 Asteroid Rocket Die
45 Deluxe Fuel Tokens
30 Deluxe Ore Tokens
12 Deluxe Player Tokens
Enhanced Score Board
Enhanced and Consolidated Rulebook




Note: The Matter Extractor card provides the same ability as the previously released Kickstarter Exclusive Space Crane card.

174930.name: No Slots
174930.description:
Educational game developed for "Libera" an anti-mafia association that wanted a game to educate people on which bar in Perugia city, Italy, were free from slot machines.

In this game a player is a gambler who is wasting all the money of his family gambling on slot machines of the city's pubs.

The other players cooperate all together moving family pawns in order to find him and sae his soul and the money of the family.

Twenty-five 3D Slot machines are placed in a 5x5 grid representing the city.

The gambler takes turns hiding the gameboard with a screen, and moving his pawn of one space. The pawn is always hidden inside a 3D slot machine. Each time he moves the pawn, he leaves one hidden gold coin below the visited slot machine.
On the family's turn, players cooperate choosing which family pawns to activate.
Family pawns stay among the 3D slot machines, on the intersections of the grid.
When activated, a family pawn may move one space OR search in a bar in the surroundings.
If searching, players can look below the chosen slot machine:

if they find the Gambler pawn, they win
if they find a Gold coin, they remove the 3D slot machine from the gameboard (several gold coins may indicate the current position of the gambler)
if they find nothing, they must put back the slot.




The gambler wins if he runs out of gold coins without being found.

174931.name: Blue Ice
174931.description:
Box Summary

Blue Ice is definitely not the typical game you are used to playing with: in fact it is barely possible to compare it with another computer game.

Through the artistic environment that appeals for all senses, players will have to explore the world of Icia to find how to enlighten Edward LCCXII to the beauty of the world and teach him how to feel sensations. The various locations of the game are each a work of art in which you need to find what is hidden inside. Along with the surprising graphics, Blue Ice also features an astonishing musical environment mixing classical, jazz and new age soundtracks

- Unique characters each with their own personalities
- Endless puzzles to test your brain
- 30 digitised music tracks delivered in Q Sound

174932.name: Fate Codex (Vol 1, Issue 7 - Dec 2014)
rpgissuearticle: Actions as Intent: Discover in FATE Core
174932.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Fate Codex is a mostly-monthly e-zine featuring Quick Start Adventures and more for the Fate roleplaying system. The project, funded through Patreon, grows and swells as more patrons support our work. We've been lucky to have lots of folks pledge.

We've also been lucky enough to feature some really great artists, including Jeremy Kostiew, Mike Mumah, Juan Ochoa, and Kaitlynn Peavler. There's some great work in this piece and over 10,000 words of awesome Fate content, ready to be thrown into your next game of Fate.

In this seventh issue, we've got:

Our own Mark Diaz Truman walks through how to add the Discover action to your games of Fate in Actions as Intent: Discover in Fate Core, providing a new means of learning interesting information and clarifying the divide between Discover and Create Advantage.
A short story by Eddy Webb called Heel Heat, diving into the world of semi-pro wrestling.
Cheyenne Rae Grimes and Nicole Winchester talk about how to use Fate to set up your own reality TV show stories in Adding Reality to Your Fantasy, providing a framework for a Fate game on a reality TV show set.
Tara Zuber's quickstart, SPIRITs, in which you get to play a team of agents plunging into the minds of misers and liars to give them a last chance to reform.




Huge thanks to our great production team--John Adamus, Sally Christensen, Shelley Harlan, Amanda Valentine, and Thomas Deeny--for keeping us on task for this issue and pushing this thing forward. We hope you enjoy it!

174933.name: 21 Vehicles
174933.description:
From publisher blurb:

Need a ride?

21 Vehicles is the first book in a new series set within our Clement Sector setting for Traveller. Within this publication are details and illustrations of twenty-one civilian and military vehicles that can be typically found within the Clement Sector.

This includes such vehicles as:

The American Dreams RetroWheels Gravcycle - A sporty vehicle seen as a statement of freedom by the youth of Cascadia.
The GUV/S Ship Utility Vehicle - An enclosed alternative to the venerable air/raft.
The Swiftwing Suborbital Hypersonic Passenger Transport - Offering fast transit from one city to another!
The AMV/G Combat Car - A venerable armored troop carrier.
The AufzugPanzer Selbstfahrlafette APz.Sfl.VI Ausf C Langen Arm self-propelled rail gun - The Hub Federation's primary self-propelled artillery!




Each of these vehicles has been designed using Supplement 5-6: The Vehicle Handbook which is available from Mongoose Publishing and thus can readily be used within any setting using the Mongoose Traveller rules system. The vehicles can be used with other Traveller settings as well with a minimum of effort.

Climb aboard!

174934.name: Ongoing Investigations: Character Options for Investigators
174934.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Game is Afoot!

Do you love the investigator class from Paizo’s Advanced Class Guide, but find yourself wishing that there were a few more options available for investigator characters? Perhaps you’d have liked to have seen some archetypes that were tailor-made for popular character types from mystery novels, movies, and television, such as corrupt detectives, investigators with drug habits, or cold and detached crime scene analysts? Maybe you wish that there was a version of the investigator that cast real spells, instead of using alchemy, and who might have unusual abilities to solve magical crimes? If so, then this book is for you, because it has all that and more!

Inside this tome you’ll find nine detailed new investigator archetypes spanning eight pages, fifteen new investigator talents, plus sixteen new feats and sixteen new spells, which benefit not only investigators, but characters of any class who are interested in finding clues, making deductions, and generally solving mysteries. An added benefit, the book also contains a section with helpful tips and tricks for constructing and running a mystery-focused adventure, which has obvious uses if you’re the GM of your party, but also serves any player interested in playing such a game with a convenient way to hint to their GMs on the subject, while also providing those GMs with useful advice on how to make those desires come true.

Whether you just want to give your existing an investigator an extra edge, or are looking to start up an entire mystery game from the beginning, or anywhere in between, this book has something for anyone with a love of mystery, crime, or investigators.

174935.name: Giant Slaying Spells
174935.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Ultimate Proof of Brains Over Brawns

Giants are fearsome foes that are never to be underestimated. Their great size makes even the dumbest and simplest among them, such as the lowly hill giants, into a serious threat, but the more powerful and cunning giants are much more dangerous still. Many adventurers make the mistake of attempting to fight these giants head-on, matching their might against those of these towering monstrosities. While admirable and heroic, this is also incredibly dangerous.

This book contains a selection of eleven spells from the spellbook of Tyram Tin-Whistle, an accomplished halfling mage and famous slayer of giants. These tried and true spells were specially formulated for dealing with giants, and will give any enterprising giant slayers a powerful edge. Included are spells designed to defend against these titans’ favored weapons, and those that use their size against them. Further, readers will find a brief essay by Tyram Tin-Whistle himself, providing some useful pointers on how to go about combating these terrible titans. Even if you are blessed enough to live in a land free of giants, many of the spells in this tome are just as good when turned against other oversized creatures.

174936.name: The Ten Kingdoms of Alphatiev
174936.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Setting for any game system and a mini-RPG, with stats for -U- the Game of Stories!

When the world was young, there were nomadic tribes that warred with one another, elves that watched with contempt, and dwarves that wanted to be left alone. Then, the storm came, and when the winds were done shifting sands, and moving trees, a large city sat nestled in the plains. From the city came flying ships and a high magic that astonished all. Now, generations later, this city is the hub of the world. We are all beholden to Alphatiev, and our ten kingdoms are strong for it. In the dark corners, however our undoing looms. Welcome to Alphatiev.

Within this book, you'll find a complete Setting about the world of Ten Kingdoms of Alphatiev, and a customized copy of -U- Essentials which gives you everything (except 3 six-sided die) to begin playing in this strange parallel of our own world.

174937.name: Morris High
174937.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Setting for any game system and a mini-RPG, with stats for -U- the Game of Stories!

Nestled between affluent neighborhoods, shopping centers, and other suburban conveniences sits Zachary M. Morris High School. Here, the upper-middle class send their children to learn and prosper. This, however, is high school. It's not all that glorious. It is filled with judgmental views, popularity contests, grueling homework, after-school activities, and hormones. Between worrying about if they will have a date for Homecoming and trying to fit in their Glee club practice, everyone is worried about how popular they are on the Morris-meter Blog and if they will qualify for a scholarship at a state college.

Within this book, you'll find a complete Setting about the world of Morris High and a customized copy of -U- Essentials which gives you everything (except 3 six-sided die) to begin playing in this strange parallel of our own world.

174938.name: Epitomes
174938.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Setting for any game system and a mini-RPG, with stats for -U- the Game of Stories!

In the universe, there are certain concepts that are eternal such as death, fire, hope, kindness, etc.. From the moment mankind put names to things, we began comparing them against each other. In these comparisons, we discovered that some things or people were the most powerful representative, or Epitomes, of these universal concepts. These Epitomes were granted powers over those concepts and had the ability to do amazing things with them.

In 1,000 AD, the Epitome of chaos found a way to disrupt the order of the universe, and suddenly random people were chosen to become Epitomes of the universal concepts. As they died, their power was transitioned to others, and the cycle has continued since then.

Within this book, you'll find a complete Setting about the world of Epitomes and a customized copy of -U- Essentials which gives you everything (except 3 six-sided die) to begin playing in this strange parallel of our own world.

174939.name: E.M.P.
174939.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Setting for any game system and a mini-RPG, with stats for -U- the Game of Stories!

The world of Ethra has been built on an fantastic mix of science and magic. Amazing chariots fly with rockets and levitation. Doctors use nanites and healing spells to cure ailments. It is an amazing, modern world. Keeping order in this world is left up to the Electro-Magical Police. The EMP, as they are called, are trained and sanctioned by the Chamber of Nations to keep the peace locally in their assigned areas and globally, when needed. From rogue robot spiders to an Infernal Fire Lord popping up in the suburbs, the EMP are ready to keep Ethra safe.

Within this book, you'll find a complete Setting about the world of EMP and a customized copy of -U- Essentials which gives you everything (except 3 six-sided die) to begin playing in this strange parallel of our own world.

174940.name: Dragon'skin
174940.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Setting for any game system and a mini-RPG, with stats for -U- the Game of Stories!

Long ago there were dragons that roamed the earth. Then, in a single day and night, they were gone. All that was left of the dragons were their scales. Years later, some ingenious humans discovered the dragon scales and unlocked their power, thus making them the first of what is called the Dragon'skin. Slowly but surely, over the ages, more humans have been introduced to the scales of the dragons and turned into something more than human that walk among us. Near-immortal, powerful beings that live in the shadows of mankind directing it to their whims, much like their ancestors. They are the Dragon'skin.

Within this book, you'll find a complete Setting about the world of Dragon'skin and a customized copy of -U- Essentials which gives you everything (except 3 six-sided die) to begin playing in this strange parallel of our own world.

174941.name: Monstera Ball
174941.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Setting for any game system and a mini-RPG, with stats for -U- the Game of Stories!

In the land of Chipanea there is one competition that rules them all: Monstera Ball. Here, contestants armed with monsteras try to win tournaments worth hundreds, thousands, and even millions of credits. Anyone can go for the Monstera Cup, but only one champion is crowned each year. Because of the huge appeal of this grand sport, an entire commerce of finding, taming, and training with monsteras and contestants has arisen. Corporate sponsors, talented individuals, and amazingly powered monsteras all converge to make this the world past time. Welcome to the world of Monstera Ball.

Within this book, you'll find a complete Setting about the world of Monstera Ball and a customized copy of -U- Essentials which gives you everything (except 3 six-sided die) to begin playing in this strange parallel of our own world.

174942.name: Brynnyn
174942.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Brynnyn people are a hardy and resourceful folk. Naturally athletic with robust constitutions, they carved out a civilization from the primal valley of the continent, logging its dense forests, while facing the hazards of its ancient terrain. Descendants of Cythean heroes and native barbarians, the Brynnyn have emerged from their refugee past to a place of prominence among the humans of the West.

Featuring:

The Brynnyn Race, the dominant human culture of the Western Ocean,
Their history.
An overview of the Grey Maiden, the Brynnyn Goddess of death.
Specialized Subdomains.
10 new background traits for Brynnyn characters.
A primer on the Country of Brynndell and the city of Brighton.
And Much More!

174943.description:
Ninja Arena is a round-based miniatures game, which focus on predictive planning and combat strategies. Within a wooden arena 2-4 players lead their ninjas into battle. Those solid arenas allow creative setups for new, challenging skirmishes. Players can choose from four different pewter ninjas, 6 unique special abilities and arm themselfs with a nicely balanced set of melee and ranged weapons.

Short gameplay summary:

Planning phase: Players plan their three hidden actions from 18 options
Initiative: the fastest planning-player picks his desired initiative for the combat round
Combat phase: all three actions from the planning phase are executed and in case of a draw decided by initiative.
174943.name: Ninja Arena
boardgamepodcastepisode: Cult of the New Board Game Podcast Episode 031 – All About Airecon

174944.name: Worms United
174944.description:
Back of the Box

WORMS and WORMS REINFORCEMENTS are UNITED in this action packed, superbly playable game. Up to 4 teams of WORMS do battle over an ever changing battlefield with falling weapon crates, crazed exploding sheep and much more! Winner of many industry awards, so come on find out what all the fuss is about.

- Over 4 billion levels of unbeatable arcade action
- 20+ custom designed landscapes included, plus the ability to draw and include your own.
- 15+ new game options including the ability to select the worm to use on your next move, retreat option, stockpiling option, dud mines and much more besides
- IPX Network/Modem Support!

174945.name: Terre Seconde
174945.description:
User Summary

Available in French only

Terre Seconde is an original homebrew Fantasy RPG based on a universe completely inspired by our own world history and cultures. It also provide its own set a simulation rules with an emphasis on roleplay.


The whole game is published as a website.

174946.description:
Entropy: The Ronin is an expansion for the card game Entropy. The expansion makes it possible to play as a new character: The Ronin. The goal of the Ronin player is different, it's about complete another player's world. To do so the Ronin can use Wild Fragments, but also have two unique character abilities (one more skill then the other players). Although the Ronin does not have an own world panorama, the two ability cards combine makes a panorama.

The expansion also adds a set of action cards to fully support six players.
174946.name: Entropy: The Ronin expansion

174948.name: Drizzlepath
174948.description:
User Summary

Drizzlepath is a walking simulator where your destination is the top of a Mountain. The goal of the game is to be atmospheric, relaxed, and an experience.

174949.name: Casus Belli (v4, Special Issue 1 - Sep 2014)
174949.description:
User Summary

Only available in French

In this special issue, Casus Belli presents Chroniques Oubliées Fantasy, a complete d20 based Fantasy RPG, OGL licensed.

With new enhancement like battle fighting rules, and a new adventure module.

This issue is also available in a Deluxe hardcover edition with the exact same content.

174950.name: Feuilles de personnage
174950.description:
User Summary

Printed empty character sheets for use with Aventures Fantastiques.

174951.name: Shiftlings
174951.description:
SHIFTLINGS is the universally (and we mean that literally) popular hyper-show that has our two tenacious tech’s bravely battle blunders and booboos through the most zany and exotic locales of the known universe. Shift work at its best!

Jump into the thick of things and take control of either (or both) of our state of the art custodial clones and jump, push, puzzle, and giggle-snort your way through over 50 levels of shenanigans and insanity through five gorgeous, quirky, and hilariously narrated worlds.

Come make new friends (or dispose of old ones). Accidentally conjoined but happily inseparable, team work and mayhem are the only way to get the job done on Shiftlings as you shift the bulk between the two characters to solve mind-boggling puzzles and death-defying traps!

Source: The Developer Website.

174952.name: Monstres et Tresors
174952.description:
User Summary

Available only in French

Volume 2 of Aventures Fantastiques: Monsters and Treasures. Contains 25 monsters, treasures and objects to find, as well as encounter tables.

This item is only available as a PDF download.

174953.description:
English:
In the game "All against the Dengue!" players must treat cases of the disease in cities and eliminate vector breeding Aedes aegypti for dengue and Chikungunya. They also have to deal with cases of Leptospirosis, caused by the urine of mice present in flooding.

To eliminate the breeding of Aedes aegypti, players will use cards and dice. For the treatment of diseases, players will use only dice. It is possible for players to improve the outcome of dice, with the acquisition of knowledge about the disease and the breeding of Aedes aegypti.

During the game, players must eliminate Aedes aegypti vector breeding and treat disease. The Cards round will add new scriadouros vector and new diseases. The aim of the players is tp decrease number of breeding vector and number of diseases, as low as possible. This way they can get a good evaluation at the end of the game.

The Aedes aegypti has caused many problems in cities such as the large number of cases and outbreaks of diseases. The lack of poorly trained infrastructure and public officials, makes the population has a very important role in the fight against Dengue, Chikungunya and leptospirosis.

Português:

No jogo "Todos contra a Dengue "os jogadores devem tratar casos da doença em cidades e eliminar o criadouro do vetor Aedes aegypti para Dengue e Chikungunya. Eles também têm de lidar com casos de Leptospirose, causada pela urina de ratos presentes em inundações.
Para eliminar a reprodução do Aedes aegypti, os jogadores vão usar Cards e também Dice. Para o tratamento de doenças, os jogadores vão usar apenas Dice . É possível para os jogadores melhorar o resultado do Dice, com a aquisição de conhecimento sobre as doenças e também em criadouro do vetor Aedes Aegypti.
Durante o jogo, os jogadores devem eliminar criadouros do vetor Aedes Aegypti e tratar doenças. As Cards de rodada irá adicionar novo scriadouros do vetor e novas doenças. O objetivo dos jogadores é dexar número de criadouros do vetor e número de doenças, o mais baixo possível. Desta forma, poderão ter uma boa avaliação no final do jogo.

O Aedes aegypti tem causado muitos problemas em cidades como o grande número de casos de surtos e doenças. A falta de infra-estrutura e os funcionários públicos mal treinado, faz com que a população tem um papel muito importante no combate à Dengue, Chikungunya e leptospirose.
174953.name: Todos contra a Dengue!

174954.name: Portes, Monstres & Trésors (2nd Edition)
174954.description:
Translated Publisher's Blurb

You are an incurable nostalgic that keeps their relic like the precious "red box", a young gamer curious to know what the elders played, or just someone who wants a simple but complete medieval fantasy role playing games? Portes, Monstres & Trésors (Doors, Monsters & Treasures) is for you!

This free and complete game published as a PDF is a translation and adaptation of the Open Gaming Licensed Labyrinth Lord, written by Daniel Proctor and published by Goblinoid Games. As a model, PMT emulates the mechanisms of the B/X version of D&D (the one published in 1981). Connoisseurs will notice that we have added two optional rules: the unique saving throw and increasing armor class.

Why not make an official French version of Labyrinth Lord?
Just because negotiations with Daniel Proctor on the Labyrinth Lord license have failed. While most of Labyrinth Lord (text and maps) is Open Gaming Licensed, the brand "Labyrinth Lord" and the layout are not, which is why we have adopted a new layout and found a new name for this version.

This second edition enhances the layout to be closer to the B/X version, add a revised introduction, and more and better illustrations.

174955.name: Strange Frequencies
174955.description:
Nutshell

A team of oddball experts travel the country investigating weird phenomena for a sketchy “reality” television show. Most of the time the things they hunt are just Hollywood smoke and mirrors, but the team knows the paranormal is very real… because they’re
being haunted.

174956.name: Beyond eyes
videogamehonor: 2016 Emotional Games Best Artistic Game Nominee
2016 Emotional Games Game of the Year Nominee
174956.description:
User Summary

you play as a young blind girl named Rae who is looking for her lost cat. Because the character can’t see what’s out ahead of her, neither can you. As you walk around the area, Rae’s other senses — primarily touch and hearing — are used to discover the surrounding landscape, which is filled in as if someone is painting the area with watercolors.

174959.name: The First Jihad
boardgamefamily: Victory Point Games States of Siege Series
174959.description: A States of Siege solitaire game from Victory Point Games, to be released later in 2016. The First Jihad simulates the rise of the Umayyad Caliphate between 632 and 750 AD. The game's AI plays the forces of the Muslim Caliphate, based in Mecca (the game's center position); the player plays a host of nations invaded by the Caliphate (Byzantium, Persia, Visigothic Spain, Nubians, Khazars, Armenians, the Chinese, Indian states, etc.) The game has about 60 counters and one 11x17" map.

174960.name: Last Days of the Library
174960.description:
Nutshell

Emperor Aurelian is preparing to burn the Library of Alexandria, but those who work there are making some preparations of their own.

174961.name: Ätherklänge
174961.description:
User summary

Ätherklänge is a soundtrack for the Space: 1889 RPG. It was composed by Ralf Kurtsiefer, with some tracks incorporating motives by Wagner, Grieg, Tchaikovsky, Bruckner, Mahler, Puccini, Satie, J. Strauss, and J.S. Bach.

Konstantine Kazantzis contributed a track to the album.

Publisher blurb (German)

Ätherklänge lädt Sie ein, auf eine musikalische Reise durch das bekannte Sonnensystem. Besuchen sie Merkus, Venus, Mars und die Höhlensystem des Erdenmondes.

Ideal geeignet als Hintergrundmusik für jede Space: 1889 Rollenspielrunde und andere Steampunk Rollenspiele.

Audio-CD inkl. 8-seitigem Booklet

174962.name: BOOMorBUST
174962.description:
1940's America, Hidden Value Property Game

In the early 1940’s the Great Depression was finally beginning to ease. Americans were earning more and being able to buy more goods. In turn further fueling the economy!

The US Government made the decision to spend over half a million on making new and renewing properties to support this economy boom.

The government also introduced trespassing fees and crowding regulations due to the general panic of invasion, during the war.

You are one of four property tycoons who are trying to corner the market and make the best Real Estate Deals! It’s an all-out property war, it's BOOM or BUST baby!

Game Overview

The idea of the game is to move around the board and purchases property (hidden value) in an attempt to have the most money and combined property value by the end of the game (all property is sold).

Players have to be aware of their purchases to make sure they have enough money in the correct account to be able to pay bills and property purchases.

There are also various ways to exchange, trade or sell property. Plus there are three slightly different auction systems (Bank, Secret Bid and private auction) that allow players to bid on a property owned by the bank or other players.

174965.name: Die Augen des Todes
174965.description:
User summary

Die Augen des Todes is a German generic fantasy scenario based in a city, written by Gunnar Segerdahl. The premise of the module is that by chance one of the characters is enchanted and suddenly can kill with a look from his eyes.

From the back of the book

Mal ehrlich...
Haben Sie sich nicht auch schon einmal in einer Stunde des Zorns gewünscht, mit Ihren Blicken töten zu können?

Wie überraschend mag es dann erst sein, wenn man urplötzlich in den zweifelhaften Genuß dieser Fähigkeit kommt.

Auf der Suche nach der Ursache geraten die Abenteurer in einen Strudel voller Ereignisse um eine geheimnisvolle Sekte, politische Intrigen und die Reinkarnation eins Gottkönigs.

Das Abenteuerbuch enthält unter anderem eine komplett ausgearbeitete Stadt mit ausführlichen Erklärungen und gibt somit dem Spielleiter die Möglichkeit, selbst bei unvorhersehbarem Verhalten der Abenteurer sofort zu reagieren.

Durch die realistische Darstellung der Stadt mit Ihren Besonderheiten können sich die Charaktere schnell in die Atmosphäre einfühlen.

Die Augen des Todes: Ein Szenario für alle bekannten Fantasy-Rollenspiele aus der Serie der QM-Abenteuer.

174966.name: Daedalus (Halloween 2004 Special Issue)
174966.description: The third issue of Daedalus is a Halloween special and focuses on horror in role-playing games. It features seven contributions: Three games, a sneak peek, and three articles.

174967.name: Daedalus (Spring 2005 Special Issue)
174967.description: The fourth and final issue of Daedalus mainly deals with super heroes, publishing a game by Jared Sorensen, and interviewing Michael Miller about With Great Power. Miller also contributes an article on running My Life With Master. The issue also contains an introduction to/ sneak peek for Chad Underkoffler's Truth & Justice.

174968.name: Periodyx
174968.description:
Periodyx is a card game based on the Periodic Table of Elements. The game can be played by 2-10 players. Each player is dealt 5 cards, the winner of the game is either: The first player to hold 10 cards, or if one player loses all their cards the player who, at that point, holds the most cards. Cards are gained or lost among players or from a central pile. A Game indicator card with the titles of 11 games is passed around the players the holder of this card being the "lead player" in each of the 11 rounds thus making each round of play random, and different. The prime purpose of the game is to become familiar with the elements, players with more familiarity will stand a higher chance of winning.

The rounds listed on the Periodyx Game Indicator Card are:

1) Atomic Power!
The lead player asks ONE OTHER player to choose a card in their hand and to read out loud that element’s name (do not show the card). The lead player then chooses a card from their own hand, and reads out loud the element’s name. Both cards are now compared. The player whose card has the HIGHER Atomic Number wins, takes both cards, and adds them to the cards in their hand. This ends this lead player’s turn and play moves on to the next player.

2) A-2-Z!
The new lead player picks any letter of the alphabet and then asks ONE player of their choice if they have an element beginning with the letter they have named. If the asked player DOES have an element that begins with the letter the lead player asked for, they must give the lead player the card (or cards if they have more than one that begins with the asked for letter). This ends the lead player’s turn, and play moves on to the next player.
If the asked player DOES NOT have an element that begins with the letter, the lead player asked for, the ASKED player takes the top card from the “draw pile” and adds it to the cards in their hand.
This ends this lead player’s turn, and play moves on to the next player.

3) Hot Stuff!
The new lead player asks ONE OTHER player to choose a card in their hand and to read out loud that element’s name (do not show the card). The lead player then chooses a card from their own hand, and reads out loud the element’s name. Both cards are now compared. The player whose card has the HIGHER boiling point wins, takes both cards, and adds them to the cards in their hand.
This ends this lead player’s turn, and play moves on to the next player.

4) Hi-Lo!
The new lead player takes any one card from their hand, and places it face up in front of them. From this card the lead player chooses ANY ONE of the stats from in the Stat Section (except the date stat) and predicts whether the next card turned over from the “draw pile” will have a higher or a lower number in the same stat. Once the prediction is made, the top card from the “draw pile” is turned over and the two cards are compared.
If the lead player has predicted correctly, they take both cards, and adds them to the cards in their hand. If the lead player has predicted incorrectly, both cards are given to the player on their left.
This ends this lead player’s turn, and play moves on to the next player.

5) Neutron Countdown!
The lead player asks ONE OTHER player to choose a card in their hand, and to read out loud the name of the element (do not show the card). The lead player then chooses a card from their own hand, and reads out loud that element’s name. Both cards are now compared. The player whose card has the HIGHER number of neutrons wins, takes both cards, and adds them to the cards in their hand.
This ends this player’s turn, and play moves on to the next player.

6) Add-it!
The lead player takes the top card from the “draw pile,” and adds it to the cards in their hand. This ends this lead player’s turn, and play moves on to the next player.

7) Big Freeze!
The new lead player asks ONE OTHER player to choose a card in their hand, and to read out loud that element’s name (do not show the card). The lead player then chooses a card from their own hand, and reads out loud the element’s name. Both cards are now compared. The player whose card has the LOWER melting point wins, takes both cards, and adds them to the cards in their hand. This ends this lead player’s turn, and play moves on to the next player.

8) Element of Surprise!
The lead player asks ONE OTHER player to hold out their cards fanned-out, facedown. The lead player then takes ANY ONE card from the asked player, and adds it to the cards in their hand. This ends this lead player’s turn, and play moves on to the next player.

SPECIAL NOTE: The lead player cannot take the LAST card from any player.




9) Early Bird!
The lead player takes ANY card from their hand, and places it face up in front of them. They then predict whether the next card turned over from the “draw pile” will have an earlier or later date of discovery than their card. Once the prediction is made, the top card from the “draw pile” is turned over, and compared. If the lead player has predicted correctly, they take both cards and add them to the cards in their hand. If the lead player has predicted incorrectly, both cards are given to the player on their left. This ends this lead player’s turn, and play moves on to the next player.

10) Match!
The lead player takes ANY card from their hand, and places it face up in front of them. They then ask ONE OTHER player to do the same.
Now ALL of the players play at the same time and try to be the first player to spot how the two cards match, or are the same in any way. Are they both metals? Both solids? Do both element names begin with the letter ‘P’, any similarity can be a correct match. The first player to spot the match keeps both the matched cards. This ends this lead player’s turn, and play moves on to the next player.

11) Natural/Synthetic/Atomic
The lead player takes ANY card from their hand, and places it facedown in front of them. They then ask ONE OTHER player to do the same. Both cards are turned over, face up at the same time. Check the Natural/Synthetic/Atomic symbols at the bottom of the cards:
• Natural beats synthetic/atomic,
• Natural/atomic beats natural
• Synthetic/atomic beats natural/atomic.
The winner takes both cards, and adds them to the cards in their hand. If it is a tie, both players keep their own cards. This ends this lead player’s turn, and play moves on to the next player.

The Mendeleev Card
If on a player’s turn (before taking their turn), they can place a card next to the Mendeleev Card so that the colored bars match (see example) they may play that card on the table and draw 2 cards from the “draw pile.” If there are 2 or more cards in play on the table (this begins to form the periodic table). Any cards that match any of the cards can be played in this manner, drawing two fresh cards for each card played.
Winning!

Two ways to end the game:

1) The first player to collect TEN cards in their hand immediately stops and wins the game!

2) The first player to lose ALL the cards in their hand stops the game. The player who, when the game is stopped, has the highest number of cards in their hand is declared the winner. In the case of a tie, the player who has the card with the highest Atomic Number wins.
Ties or N/A!
If during any round of play the stats are tied, the round is void, this ends the lead player’s turn, and play moves on to the next player, and the next game on the Periodyx Game Indicator Card.

If there is a N/A (not applicable) on a card, this round is void. Players have the option to keep a card with a N/A or to exchange it by returning it to the bottom of the draw pile and taking the top card from the draw pile.

There is an expansion book available with rules for 10 further games.

174969.name: Explorers & Exploiters
174969.description:
In Explorers & Exploiters, you are one of several leaders over a people, exploring and exploiting the resources of a New World. However, you also lead the barbarians fighting against the people.

Each player starts with a number of settlements in different sizes; hamlets, villages, towns and cities. The first player to place all of them on the board is the winner.

The world is made up of tiles of different kinds - foundations for settlements, resources necessary for settlements, and useless wastelands. At the start, the world is terra incognita and all tiles are turned face down, waiting to be explored by the units.

The units in the world are of two kinds - explorers and barbarians. They do not belong to particular players but any player may act with them. Explorers may explore a tile (move to it and look at it privately) or exploit a tile (turn it face up and make it available for all players). Barbarians on the other hand plunder tiles and turn them face down again.

By turning tiles face up or face down, players may make more or less resources connected to settlements. This allows the settlement to be expanded or expelled and the player to replace the existing settlement with one from the hand.

The challenge of the game is to play the common units so that the right settlement can be played in the right place at the right time.

There are no such things as ”mine” and ”yours”, nor such things as ”good” and ”evil”. All units are commonly played, whether they be explorers or barbarians. To win, you must use the common resources to rise above the commons, not unlike the challenges of a real leader!

174970.name: The Edge
174970.description:
The Edge is a skirmish scaled 35 mm wargame set in the post-apocalyptic world with medieval and steampunk aesthetic influences. It’s mechanic combines the traditional wargame approach and solutions from mana-based card games.

In a world destroyed by cataclysmic Judgement Day that left behind not only havoc and desolation, but also beneficial crystals and mysterious portals, remnants of humanity are unified under the authoritative rule of The Chapter, the priesthood of The One, a god of technology, defending humanity against Demons, conquerors of whole worlds, which one day came out of the portals. In the bloody war that followed, from the dead human bodies, broken machine parts and power of the crystals new entity was born by ominous and barely understood method – The Faceless, beings deprived of autonomic consciousness and emotions, devouring both metal and flesh, through which implementations every creature evolves on its own.

The humanity found a way to use the scattered crystals to create and empower mechanical blessings of The One, but the Demons have their own reasons to gather them and even The Faceless have their purpose to seek the crystals, as the power that dwells in them is fueling the hulks of their physical forms.

174971.name: Casus Belli (Issue 36 - Feb 1987)
rpgissuearticle: Devine Qui Vient Dîner Ce Soir
Dis moi Monsieur Caledo, dessine moi un monstre
Metalliques: Sans chair et en os.
174971.description:
(translated) From the cover
